REFTEXT: Description 11th AD
当初はヒトラー自身の護衛として発足したLAHは,最も誉れ高い師団の一つとして大戦を通して増強されてきた.ヒトラーの≪Old Guard≫とみなされ,戦争後期にはエリート士官を産み出す温床となっていた.
CLASSEMENT: Originaly formed from Hitler's own bodyguard, LAH has expanded over the course of the war into one of the Third Reich's most prestigious and powerful division. Often regarded as Hitler's « Old Guard », it was the breeding ground from which most of the Waffen-SS' late war superior officers originated.

REFTEXT: Description 227th Infantry Brigade operation Bluecoat
Description 2nd CAB
Description II. SS-Pz-K
Description 2nd Ranger Bat Pointe du Hoc
Description 326. Infanterie Division deck A operation Bluecoat
Description 326. Infanterie Division deck B operation Bluecoat
Description 4th CAD
Description 6th Guard Tank Brigade operation Bluecoat
Description 90th ID
強力なドイツ軍と対峙したため猛烈な戦闘が行われたジュノー海岸,唯一D-Day作戦目標の全てを達成できた第3カナダ歩兵師団は,その日かろうじて他の師団よりも内陸部に侵攻していた. 第一次世界大戦時における彼らの祖先の評判通りの働きに,カナダ軍歩兵部隊は,敵から「大英帝国の突撃隊員」として特別な感情を持って扱われていた.
CLASSEMENT: Storming Juno Beach in the face of strong German resistance, the 3rd Canadian Infantry was the only allied division to achieve all of its D-Day objectives, also managing to penetrate further inland than any other division that day. True to the reputation of their WW1 forefathers, the Canadian infantrymen were regarded by their enemies as the "Stormtroopers of the British Empire".

REFTEXT: もとより祖国で戦うことを熱望していた自由フランス軍は,己の首都を解放する名誉を得るためなら,損失に構うこと無くパリに向かう道の先を争った.
CLASSEMENT: Free Frenchmen were eager to fight on their own soil at long last, racing towards Paris, regardless of losses, to be the ones liberating their capital. Theoretically organised as a US armored division, the 2e DB implemented some "personal changes", such as the addition of an organic Wolverine battalion, and a focus on light tanks and armored cars.

REFTEXT: 2個特殊降下大隊で編成されたDBSASは,D-Dayの前日,ブルターニュでの破壊工作と,できるだけ多くの敵部隊をノルマンディから引き剥がす陽動作戦を目的とし降下した.数千のレジスタンスメンバーも加え,彼らの占領軍との戦いは,パットン軍団に救い出された,6月18日のサン＝マルセルでの戦いで終わりを迎えた.
CLASSEMENT: The DBSAS, made up of two special forces airborne battalions, was dropped on Day -1 in Brittany to wreak havoc and divert as many enemy troops as possible in order to tie them away from Normandy. Joined by thousands of Résistance members, they fought a pirate war against occupation troops, culminating in the battle of Saint-Marcel on June 18th, until relieved by Patton's army.

REFTEXT: 第116装甲師団は,D-Dayのわずか3ヶ月前に東部戦線の残存兵と予備役を寄せ集めて編成された混成団だった. たとえ新型戦車における経験と訓練が足りてなくとも,第116師団は他の装甲師団とは異なり,より旧式で,より軽量な車種であっても十分使いこなせるという特殊な事情を持っていた.
CLASSEMENT: Formed only three months before D-Day by merging survivors from the East Front with reserve units, the 116. Panzer Division was a motley crew. Although lacking in experience and training on their newest tanks, the 116. had the particularity, unlike other Panzer divisions, of having been able to retain some of its older, lighter models.

REFTEXT: ヒットラーユーゲントから選抜した17歳～18歳の狂信的なティーンエイジャーを中心に編成され,鬼軍曹や下士官に率いられた第12SS装甲師団は,ノルマンディにおいて最も恐れられる部隊であることを証明した.新型の車両と武装をふんだんに与えられ,第12SSは西部戦線における最も装備が充実していた装甲師団の一つだった.
CLASSEMENT: Formed from fanatical 17- or 18-year-old teenagers drawn from the ranks of Hitler Youth, and led by battle-hardened officers & NCOs, the 12. SS-Panzer proved to be the Allies' most dreaded opponent in Normandy. Lavishly provided with modern vehicles and guns, the 12. SS was one of the best equipped Panzer divisions on the Western Front.

REFTEXT: 第16空軍野戦師団は,ルフトヴァッフェの余剰地上要員を戦闘部隊に編入して創設された.士気は低く時代遅れの装備で,彼らは通常のドイツ軍部隊には程遠かった.鹵獲した雑多なフランス軍車両と突撃砲(StuG)の支援を受けていた彼らは,悪くとも良く装備され訓練された多目的対空砲は頼りにすることができた.
CLASSEMENT: 16. Luftwaffe-Felddivision was made up of supernumerary Luftwaffe ground personnel pressed into combat units. With low morale and often outdated equipment, they were far from the usual hard-fighting German Grenadiers. Supported by a motley assortment of captured French vehicles and StuGs, they can at least rely on well-equipped and trained multi-purpose Flak guns.

REFTEXT: ノルマンディ唯一の装甲擲弾兵師団,17師団は,車両を多数欠いていたが,4号突撃砲戦車は定数分を完全に装備していた.ボカージュ中での戦闘では,重装備の不足は,さほどハンディキャップにはならなかった.シルエットが低い突撃砲は,効果的な待ち伏せと反撃で期待通りの働きをしてくれた.
CLASSEMENT: The only Panzer Grenadier division in Normandy, the 17. lacked many vehicles, yet had a full complement of modern StuG IV assault guns. Engaged in bocage country, its lack of heavy equipment was less of a handicap. There, the low profile StuGs worked wonders, as effective in ambush as in counter-attacks.

REFTEXT: 1943年チュニジアで壊滅したエリート集団第21装甲師団は,フランスで残存兵と予備役から再編成し,フランスでの鹵獲車両を改造して装備していた. D-Day当日,ゆいいつ海岸の近くにいて連合軍の侵攻に即応しえる装甲師団であった.
CLASSEMENT: Destroyed in Tunisia in 1943, the elite 21. Panzer division was reformed in France from surviving personnel and reserve units, and equipped mostly with modified captured French armored vehicles. Close to the beaches, it was the only Panzer division to react immediately to the allied invasion and counter-attack on D-Day.

REFTEXT: 古参で最も長い歴史を持つドイツ装甲師団の一つである第2装甲師団は≪旧式≫の装甲師団であり,1939年から欧州での全ての戦役に従事していた.ドイツ軍の中で最も経験豊富な師団の一つでもあり,連合軍の作戦立案者からは「西部戦線において最も危険な師団」とみなされている.
CLASSEMENT: 2. Panzer is the « old breed » of the Panzerwaffe, one of the oldest and longest serving German armoured divisions, having taken part in every campaign in Europe since 1939. One of Germany's most experienced divisions, it was regarded by Allied planners as one of the most dangerous single units on the Western front.

REFTEXT: いくつかの東部戦線師団の残存兵を寄せ集めた第352歩兵師団は,連合国がそれと気付かないD-Day直前に,オマハビーチに配備された.よく訓練され熟練兵が強い核となった師団は,一日中その地で耐え,初日に連合軍の侵攻をほぼ阻止する程の損失を米軍にもたらした.
CLASSEMENT: Amalgamating survivors from several Eastern Front divisions, the 352. took position at Omaha Beach just prior to D-Day without the Allies having noticed it. Well trained and armed, and with a strong core of veterans, the division stood its ground all day, inflicting such losses on the Americans that it almost foiled the allied invasion on the first day.

REFTEXT: 第3降下猟兵師団は,ノルマンディーで連合国が直面した最も難しい対戦相手の1つであることを証明した. 重装備や装甲車両が欠けていたにも関わらず,彼らは非常に意欲的で,よく指揮され,第三帝国が集められる最高の武器を装備し,ボカージュでの火力は比類ないものだった...
CLASSEMENT: The 3. Fallshirmjäger-Division proved to be among the toughest opponents the Allies faced in Normandy. Although lacking heavy guns and armour, they were highly motivated, well led, and equipped with the best weapons the Reich could muster. In the bocage, their firepower was unmatched…

REFTEXT: 唯一6月11日に上陸した,第4≪軽≫機甲師団は,パットン戦車軍団の一角を担っていた:コブラ作戦の成功の鍵を担っていた.彼らはドイツ軍正面を突破し,クータンスを取ったあとブリュターニュ解放の為に西方へ進路をとった.
CLASSEMENT: Only landed in Normandy on July 11th, the « light » 4th Armored was the tip of General Patton's spear: leading the way for Operation Cobra's exploitation, they broke through the German front, capturing Coutances then swinging West to liberate Britanny.

REFTEXT: 第716歩兵師団は,年齢が過ぎたり,若すぎたり,戦線に送るにはあまりにも健康を害していたり,それだけではなくロシア人やイタリア人で構成されていた.
CLASSEMENT: The 716. was formed of men who were too old, too young or too sick to be sent to the front, as well as Soviet & Italian "volunteers" drawn from POW camps. A static division, it lacked armored vehicles, but compensated with a superior provision of artillery which included heavy coastal or train guns, and heavy submachine-guns to stop the Allies.

REFTEXT: 空輸可能な師団として編成された第91空輸師団だったが,その意味はただちに失われ,ノルマンディには普通の歩兵師団として転戦した.戦闘力を追加するため多くの部隊を増援されたが,結局,連合軍と戦うと,雑多な兵科を寄せ集めた歩兵師団,フランス鹵獲戦車,エリート降下兵だということがわかった.
CLASSEMENT: Formed as an air transportable division, the 91. Luftlande soon lost its original meaning and was moved to Normandy as a regular infantry division. Reinforced with so many units to add muscle power, it ended up fighting the Allies as a motley assortment of regular infantrymen, French training tanks, elite paratroopers, and assault guns…

REFTEXT: 第9装甲師団はフランスに配置転換されて,再編成と新しい装備を受け取るまでの丸3年間を東部戦線で戦っていた.師団のベテラン兵は,四号戦車やマーダー,トレードマークの二号軽戦車(Luchs)のような,旧式ではあるが,より頼りになる車両の扱いに,特に熟練していた.
CLASSEMENT: 9. Panzer has fought for almost three continuous years on the Eastern Front before being sent to France to refit and train on new equipment. Yet, the divisions' veterans are especially proficient with their older and more reliable vehicles, such as Panzer IV & Marder, or its trademark Panzer II Luchs light tank.

REFTEXT: 第1特殊任務旅団は,数個大隊から構成され,工兵車両,戦車などの支援がエリート部隊に組み込まれていた.全ての西側近代特殊部隊創設の父であり,英国コマンドーは,どのような歩兵部隊にも対応できる連合軍で最も優れた兵士である.しかし彼らは,対戦車装備を持たないため装甲部隊には対応できず脆い.
CLASSEMENT: 1st Special Service Brigade brought several commando battalions together, supported by engineer vehicles and tank, into an elite assault unit. Fathers to all modern Western special forces, the British commandos are the best Allied soldiers, able to deal with any infantry force. But they are fragile and lacking in anti-tank guns to deal with armors.

REFTEXT: 要塞 Gros-Paris は,パリが連合軍の手に落ちるのを防ぐため,フォン・コルティッツ麾下の全部隊を再編成した.これは脆弱な第325予備師団を核に,'グレーター・パリ'範囲内の全部隊を併合したものだった.雑多な対空兵器,二戦級の兵士達,決して諦めない(ダイハードな)ＳＳ,保安部隊からの旧式1号戦車と,ノルマンディから再装備された単騎のパンターとティーガー.
CLASSEMENT: Festung Groß-Paris regroups all the forces placed under General von Choltitz's authority to prevent Paris from falling to the Allies. Built around the weak 325. Sicherungs-Division, it amalgamates all units within the 'Greater Paris' area, a motley assortment of Flak units, disheartened desk-soldiers and die-hard SS, old Panzer I from security outfits, and individual crack Panthers or Tigers refitting from the Normandy campaign.

REFTEXT: パンツァーレーアは教導師団として編成してあり,ほとんどの隊員は教官か経験豊かな熟練兵だった.第三帝国の中で最も優秀な装甲師団のひとつであるパンツァーレーアは,最高の装備が与えられ,TigerIやTigerIIさえも所有していた.
CLASSEMENT: With Panzer-Lehr being formed from an instruction unit, most of its members were instructors or seasoned veterans. One of the Reich's most elite Panzer divisions, Panzer-Lehr was the best equipped one, even possessing its own Tiger & Tiger II tanks.

REFTEXT: 彼らの復讐への欲望は揺るがず,自由ポーランド軍はカナダ第1軍の先駆けだった.彼らの精神にあった軽騎兵戦術を採用し,彼らはモン=オルメルに至るまでドイツ軍を悩ませ,そこで彼らは単独で,二つの軍の流れに立ち向かった.
CLASSEMENT: Unwavering in their desire for vengeance, the Free Poles were the vanguard of the First Canadian Army. Adopting light cavalry tactics more suited to their spirit, they harassed the Germans up to Mont Ormel, where they stood their ground alone against the tide of two armies.

REFTEXT: 経験不足とはいえ,第15歩兵師団は,多くのベテラン英軍部隊よりもノルマンディーでうまく事が進んだ.チャーチル戦車に援護されたスコットランド兵は,恐怖の第12SS装甲師団を攻撃して,これを後退させ,ドイツ軍の貴重な装甲ユニットの,いくつか彼らに向かわせるよう仕向けた.
CLASSEMENT: Although inexperienced, the 15th Infantry Division fared better in Normandy than many veteran British units. Supported by Churchill’s tanks, the Scots attacked and gained ground on the dreaded 12. SS-Panzer, forcing the Germans to commit several of their precious armored units against them.

REFTEXT: Description 3rd ID UK
D-Day当日に作戦行動をとった最初の師団である第6空挺師団は,侵攻向かって左翼を確保する任務を課されていた.それは中型対戦車砲と,グライダーによって空輸された軽戦車などの重装備を施した空挺部隊であった.
CLASSEMENT: The first Allied division to enter action on D-Day, the 6th Airborne was tasked with securing the left flank of the invasion. It was quite heavily equipped for an airborne unit, with medium AT guns & light tanks being brought by air by heavy Hamilcar cargo gliders.

REFTEXT: 第7機甲師団, 北アフリカで名高い ≪デザート ラッツ≫ はモントゴメリー将軍の第13軍に属するイギリス軍の中で最も経験豊富な師団の一つであり,砂漠の日々のような輝かしい電撃作戦を遂行したクロムウェル巡航戦車をほぼ完全装備した選び抜かれた装甲師団だった,しかしノルマンディのボカージュは,砂漠のようには見通しが良くなく,かつてのベテラン達も･･･
CLASSEMENT: The 7th Armoured Division, the « Desert rats » of North Africa fame, was General Montgomery's XIII Legion. One of the most experienced divisions in the British order of battle, it was singled-out amongst armoured divisions to be almost entirely equipped with fast Cromwell tanks in order to perform lightning strikes, as in the glorious desert days. But the cramped Normandy bocage wasn't the open fields that the desert veterans were used to…

REFTEXT: 王の兵士を意味する近衛師団は,最高の装備を与えられていた.ノルマンディでは非常に状態の良いドイツ軍と対峙し,近衛師団はひどい損害を被ったが,タイガーIIと交戦し,これを初めて破った連合国部隊でもあった.
CLASSEMENT: Comprising the King's own men, the Household Division was bestowed with the best equipment. In Normandy, faced with the best German units, the Guards suffered terrible losses but were also the first Allies to engage and score a victory over Tiger II tanks.

REFTEXT: 米軍の空挺兵はコタンタンを越えて,連合軍の右翼を確保し,ドイツ軍エリート降下兵やボカージュに紛れたSSの反撃を撃退した.非常に軽装備な'Screaming Eagles'は,エリート歩兵の他に, 空軍の近接支援や,海軍の艦砲射撃などの緊密な支援を受けていた.
CLASSEMENT: American paratroopers jumped over the Cotentin to secure the Allied right flank, repelling counter-attacks by elite paratroopers or SS assault guns in the deadly bocage. Very lightly equipped, the "Screaming Eagles" relied mostly on their elite infantry, and close support from the air force & navy guns.

REFTEXT: Description 29th ID
米国陸軍のなかで二大戦の間も活動していた師団のひとつ,全員が志願兵であり,第一歩兵師団は,米国がドイツとイタリアに対して参戦したとき,真っ先に派遣された.BROはあらゆるヨーロッパ戦役で戦った: アルジェリア,チュニジア,シシリー,フランス,ベルギー,ドイツ,チェコスロバキア.これほど熟練して手に終えない米歩兵師団はヨーロッパ戦役にはいなかった.
CLASSEMENT: Being one of the few interwar active divisions of the US Army, entirely composed of volunteers, 1st ID was among the very first units sent to Europe to take part in the war against the Germans & Italians when the USA entered the war. BRO fought in every campaign on the ETO: Algeria, Tunisia, Sicily, France, Belgium, Germany & Czechoslovakia. As experienced as they were unruly, there wasn't a better American infantry division on the ETO.

REFTEXT: D-Day+1に上陸した'Indianhead'は,ボカージュの国とサン・ローの遺跡を抜け,コブラ作戦を戦った.  第2歩兵師団は,ブレストの戦いにおいて米軍で初めてキシロフォンロケットランチャーを使用した部隊だった.
CLASSEMENT: Landing on D-Day +1, "Indianhead" fought its way through bocage country and the ruins of Saint-Lô to take part in Operation Cobra's breakthrough. During the battle of Brest, the 2nd ID was the first US unit to use the Xylophone rocket launcher artillery.

REFTEXT: 何週間も'hedgerow hell'で苦しめられ サン・ローでは苦しい戦いを強いられたが,ついにコブラ作戦で'Spearhead'は,なだらかに起伏する国へ突入した. それ以来,ニックネームどおり,第3機甲師団は,セーヌ川へのレースに参加し,その過程で数万のドイツ軍を捕らえた.
CLASSEMENT: Suffering for weeks in "hedgerow hell" and the heavy fighting for Saint-Lô, the "Spearhead" finally broke into rolling country with Operation Cobra. From then, true to its nickname, the 3rd Armored engaged in a race towards the Seine, capturing tens of thousands of German troops in the process.

REFTEXT: 第101空挺師団は,主に強力で汎用性のある歩兵に頼っていて,幾つかの野砲と,M22軽戦車でしか支援されていない,フェーズAでは最善を尽くす事ができる.\nフェーズCのM10駆逐戦車が陸揚げされるまでは対戦車装備が限られており,フェーズBでは,戦線を維持する神経と両方のスキルが要求されるだろう.
CLASSEMENT: 101st Airborne relies mostly on its strong and versatile infantry, but is only supported by a few towed guns & M22 light tanks, thus being at its best in Phase A.\nWith limited anti-tank capacity until Phase C and the arrival of M10 Tank Destroyers from the beaches, Phase B will require both skill and nerve to hold the ground.

REFTEXT: 多くの空挺師団ユニット(翼のアイコンがついている)は包囲されない事を覚えておけ.そうなっても彼らは気にしない...
CLASSEMENT: Remember that many airborne division's units (identified by wings on their cards) can't be surrounded. Or at least, if they are, they don't care…

REFTEXT: THE EAGLE
Hint entete description 116th Infantry Regiment
Hint etendu description 116th Infantry Regiment
CLASSEMENT: Hint étendu description 116th Infantry Regiment

REFTEXT: Surnom 116th Infantry Regiment
CLASSEMENT: 116th Infantry Regiment

REFTEXT: グレイハウンドの紋章が示すとおり,第116装甲師団は,高速な軽車両と軽戦車を持つがゆえに,フェーズAではとても強力な師団である\nフェーズBでは,Ⅳ号戦車,Ⅳ号突撃砲へと次第に火力が上がり,フェイズCではパンターが登場する.
CLASSEMENT: True to its emblem, the Greyhound, the 116. Panzer is a very strong division in Phase A, with a swarm of fast light vehicles and light tanks.\nAfterwards, it only slowly increases in power with Panzer IV & Jagdpanzer IV in Phase B, and Panther in Phase C.

REFTEXT: 歩兵は非常に高価な為,第116装甲師団は人的消耗戦を避けた方が良い.そこで,敵前線に風穴を開けるためには良好な砲兵に頼ることとなる.
CLASSEMENT: Its infantry being quite costly, 116. Panzer is better off avoiding attrition battles, but it can rely on a good artillery selection to create the needed rupture in the enemy frontline.

REFTEXT: THE SPRINTER
第11機甲師団はノルマンディにおける最も果敢な師団であろう,エプソム作戦遂行中は,112高地への攻撃の穂先として,チャーンウッド作戦では,ブルゲビュ稜へ向かう部隊として.
CLASSEMENT: 11th AD was maybe the most aggressive British armored division in Normandy, spearheading the charge toward Hill 112 during Operation Espom, and the race toward Bourguebus Ridge during Operation Charnwood.

REFTEXT: THE BULLY
第12SS装甲師団は,フェーズAでは手を焼く事になる,わずかな軽戦車と鹵獲した英国戦車(クロムウェルとファイアーフライ)に頼らざるを得ない.\nしかし,フェーズBへと進むにつれて,パンター,自走砲,FlaKへと次第に強力なっていき,戦線を押し返し始めることが可能となる.
CLASSEMENT: 12. SS-Panzer is quite at a loss in Phase A, having to rely on just a few light vehicles and a pair of scavenged British tanks (Cromwell & Firefly).\nBut it grows increasingly powerful with each passing phase from B, with a good selection of Panther, self-propelled artillery, and FlaK guns, enabling it to start pushing back.

REFTEXT: THE SERENE
使える熟練兵が無尽蔵にいるように思えるかもしれないが,フェーズAでｈ支援部隊に欠けている.\nフェーズBにおいては,大規模な砲兵や戦車の支援を受けてWW1スタイルの強力な部隊へと成長する.しかしながら機動性の欠如に妨げられる.\nフェイズCになると顕著になり,特に抱えている17ポンド砲は,最高の対戦車兵器となる.
CLASSEMENT: This seemingly inexhaustible pool of veteran, yet cheap, infantry lacks support in Phase A.\nYet it grows more powerful in Phase B, where it is at its best with massive artillery & tank support for its infantry, WW1 style. However, it is hampered by a lack of mobility.\nIt tends to get winded in Phase C, especially retaining the towed 17-pdr as its best anti-tank weapon.

REFTEXT: THE VETERAN
士気の低い歩兵と近代的な戦車からなる,第16空軍野戦師団は守備には最適だ.さらに,潤沢な火力支援車両,歩兵の火力を強化する重ホチキス機関銃,地上と空中の両方の敵を撃退可能な,よく訓練された多数の対空部隊を当てにできる.\n第16空軍野戦師団の航空機は,盤外砲撃観測機を含む,殆どが地上支援に重点が置かれている.
CLASSEMENT: With its disheartened infantry and few modern tanks, the 16. LWFD is best suited for defense. Yet, it fields an impressive number of fire support vehicles and heavy Hotchkiss machine-gun to bolster its infantry firepower, and can rely on its skilled and numerous anti-aircraft units to repel enemies both on the ground and in the air.\nWell-covered against airplanes from the ground, 16. Luftwaffe's air support focuses mostly on ground attack aircrafts, including aerial artillery observers.

REFTEXT: THE SPARROWHAWK
CLASSEMENT: THE SPARROWHAWK

REFTEXT: 軽装備であるにも関わらず,第17SSは盤外砲撃を含む砲兵によって支えられた豊富な歩兵が,フェーズAから牙を剥くことができる.\nフェーズB,Cと進んでも,攻撃力は,それほど良くはならない一方で,守備力は大幅に向上する.
CLASSEMENT: Although lightly equipped, 17. SS can show some teeth in Phase A, with a plentiful number of strong infantry supported by artillery, including off-map.\nWith the game proceeding to Phase B & C, it doesn't get much better by way of offensive power, but on the other hand it greatly increases its defensive abilities.

REFTEXT: THE ANVIL

BROは2つの兵科を当てにしている: 全てベテランかエリート歩兵(サポート要員の迫撃砲,バズーカ,軽対戦車部隊も含む)であり戦闘師団の役目を負っている.フェイズAでは強く,米海軍の支援砲撃を受けた数両の装甲車,並びに海岸線よりハーフトラックに牽引されてきた対空兵器,などの特別な戦闘チームを配置することができる … だが偵察部隊が存在しない.フェイズBはエコノミーブーストも,さらなる戦車もない,しかしフェイズCで現れる,より無傷でより安価な部隊が登場するまでの間,幾つかの支援火器を扱って,損害がでないよう陣地を維持することである.
CLASSEMENT: BRO relies mostly on two assets : its all veteran or even elite infantry force (including regimental supports such as mortar, bazookas, light AT guns, …) and its role as an assault division. Strong in Phase A, it can deploy special assault teams, some armored vehicles supported by the US Navy's firepower and even AA guns towed across the beach by AA half-track ... but is missing most recon elements. Phase B brings no economy boost nor more tanks, but some support weapons to hold the ground until more economy and fresh troops are brought in Phase C to make up for the earlier losses.

REFTEXT: BRO-FORCE
CLASSEMENT: THE ONE

REFTEXT: ポーランド軍は,フェイズAからアキレス駆逐戦車や航空支援も含む,出来る事全てを解き放てば,直ぐに強い相手と組み合えるだろう.\nしかし,これは高価であると共に,フェイズB,Cのハイエンド装備では,生存性が足りない.
CLASSEMENT: The Poles will immediately get to grips with their nemesis, unleashing everything they can from Phase A, including the Achilles tank destroyer and air support to 'soften the way'.\nBut this comes at a price, with the less high-end equipment's resilience in Phase B & C.

REFTEXT: THE VENGEFUL

まだ恐るべき戦闘マシーンであるとはいえ,かつての最強SS師団も弱体化の兆しをみせつつある.まだ東部戦線帰りのエリート兵達を数多く抱えてはいるが,過去の損失を取り返すべく準備のために,ますます多くの民族ドイツ人を徴兵している.異質な装備？:最新型のプーマやパンター,ノルマンディの他の装甲師団よりも多いⅣ号(ほとんどが簡易化されたJ型であった)と,88mm砲…,再編成と共に前線へ急行する75mm火力支援ハーフトラックや,37mm対戦車砲,装甲偵察車など多くの戦力が足りていない.LAHの特徴は,突撃砲戦車を対戦車兵器として装備している,対戦車砲が少ない分,突撃砲戦車が対戦車カテゴリーから選択できる.
CLASSEMENT: Although still a formidable fighting machine, the once most dreaded SS division is showing signs of wear. Elite troopers from the Eastern front are still there in numbers, but more and more unwilling Volksdeutschen have been pressed into its ranks to make up for its previous losses. Equipment is heterogeneous: state-of-the-art Pumas & Panthers, and more Panzer IV (although mostly of the downgraded J variant) & Flak 88mm than other armoured divisions in Normandy… Yet, rushed to the front while in the process of rearming, it misses many items such as 75mm fire support half-track, 37mm AA guns and half its armoured scouts. LAH's specific feature is to have a StuG-Abteilung acting as a Panzerjäger, meaning fewer towed-AT guns but StuGs to be selected in the AT category, in addition to tanks.

REFTEXT: THE BODYGUARD
第21装甲師団は軽機甲部隊で,多くの旧式フランス製戦車と,数両のカスタムメイドの車両などと共にフェイズAでは非常に強い.\nしかしフェイズBで巻き返されるが,フェーズCでは,Königstiger(TigerII)の登場が非常にありがたい.
CLASSEMENT: 21. Panzer is the light cavalry, very strong in Phase A with plenty of old French cavalry tanks, and some custom-made vehicles.\nBut it gets winded in phase B, although in Phase C it can count on a few very welcome Königstiger.

REFTEXT: THE TINKERER

Legend has it that the Virginians from 29th ID were earmarked as one of D-Day's first wave division because of the too many bar brawls with coloured soldiers they had initiated while in garrison in the UK. Untested in battle, the ≪?Blue & Grey?≫ happened to land in the face of the strongest enemy resistance, at Omaha Beach. Yet despite very heavy losses, they managed to break the German defences under the leadership of the division's second-in-command, General Norman Cotta, who had landed in the thick of the fight with his men.
CLASSEMENT: Legend has it that the Virginians from 29th ID were earmarked as one of D-Day's first wave division because of the too many bar brawls with coloured soldiers they had initiated while in garrison in the UK. Untested in battle, the « Blue & Grey » happened to land in the face of the strongest enemy resistance, at Omaha Beach. Yet despite very heavy losses, they managed to break the German defences under the leadership of the division's second-in-command, General Norman Cotta, who had landed in the thick of the fight with his men.

REFTEXT: interwar
フェイズAでは,第2機甲師団に,信頼のおけるエリート偵察部隊,軽戦車,車両,さらには駆逐戦車など,持てる物全てが与えられる.\nしかし,ハイエンド装備が欠けているため,フェーズBとCでは,直ぐに格下となってしまう.
CLASSEMENT: The 2e DB gives everything it has in Phase A, relying on elite recon troops, light tanks and vehicles, and even tank destroyers.\nBut it soon gets outclassed in Phase B and C, due to a lack of high-end equipment.

REFTEXT: THE SWIFT
第2装甲師団は標準の歩兵師団として編成されたが,多数の経験豊富な隊員たちによって一流として特徴付けられた.さらに,いくつかのオモチャも手にした.戦時中,師団は装備品として,Borgward IV 遠隔操作式爆薬運搬車輌と共に,付随のStugG,最新式のMP-44アサルトライフルを携行した西部戦線初の部隊を受領した.
CLASSEMENT: 2. Panzer is organised as a regular infantry division and is foremost characterised by its large number of experienced troops. Yet it also gets a few toys of its own. For the campaign, it received as an attachment a company of Borgward IV remote-controlled explosive delivery vehicles, with accompanying StuGs, and it appears to have been among the first units on the Western front to be equipped with brand new MP 44 assault rifles.

REFTEXT: Borgward IVは遠隔操作車輌で,操縦者が必要ないことを意味する.ゲーム内でのユニットは,制圧されない,降伏しない,しかし,積載している高性能炸薬が誘爆するワンショットビークルとなる.
CLASSEMENT: Borgward IV are remote-controlled vehicles, meaning without pilot. Ingame, they do not suffer from suppression, nor surrender, but self-destruct with their explosive loadout. Hence they are a one-shot vehicle.

REFTEXT: THE OLD BREED
フェーズAでの,一握りのレンジャー部隊は,対戦相手に対処させる問題を難しくさせるだろうが,非常に数が少なく,どこにでも配置する訳にはいかない,従って他の兵で隙間を埋めなくてはならない.\nフェーズB,Cの両方では,火力を増した砲兵による支援を受けたライフル兵が,この師団の屋台骨になるだろう.
CLASSEMENT: A handful of Rangers in Phase A will make life hard for their opponents, but they are too few to be everywhere at once, hence the Army grunts will have to fill the gaps.\nIn both Phase B & C, riflemen, supported by ever increasing artillery firepower, will be the backbone of this division.

REFTEXT: 少数の時代遅れのM4A1に戦車が限定されている以上,敵の装甲部隊を取り除くには,76mm対戦車砲に頼るほうが賢明だろう.
CLASSEMENT: With tanks being limited to a few obsolete M4A1, it will be wiser to rely on 76mm anti-tank guns to get rid of enemy armours.

REFTEXT: THE RANGER
第326歩兵師団は数日前にノルマンディについたばかりで,英国が前線突破の地と決めたときは、この静寂なる前線の引継ぎ中であった.彼らは,準備不足の師団のまま,ブルーコート作戦において,まさしく戦区防衛ため放たれたが,戦闘の機会がないまま,その半分の戦力を失った.
CLASSEMENT: 326. ID had just arrived in Normandy a few days before and was still in the process of taking over this quiet sector of the front when the British decided it was time to break the stalemate on their front. They unleashed Operation Bluecoat exactly on the sector defended by this untested and unprepared division, which lost iabout half its strenght without having ever really a chance to fight.

REFTEXT: THE DOOMED
フェーズAでの第352師団の主力は,攻撃能力は欠けているが,防御には適している数多くの安価な歩兵である.\nフェーズB,Cで,いくつかの非常に強力な砲兵と対戦車ユニットと共に,徐々に強力になっていく.
CLASSEMENT: 352. ID's main asset is its numerous and cheap infantry, lacking in the offensive but well suited and supported for defence in Phase A.\nIt slowly grows more powerful in Phase B & C, with some very strong artillery and anti-tank units.

REFTEXT: 大量の砲兵で先行する歩兵の進撃を撃つ'Rolling barrage'をするには最高
CLASSEMENT: Is best played as rolling barrage, with massive artillery strikes preceding infantry advance.

REFTEXT: THE MEATGRINDER
フェーズAで,敵の対戦車兵器による脅威が少ないうちは,大型のパーソナルキャリアや,軽量火炎放射車両で,第3カナダ歩兵師団は敵を圧倒する.\nしかし自軍の対戦車兵器数は,フェーズCにならないと向上しない為,フェーズBでは苦戦を強いられることが予想される.
CLASSEMENT: With its heavy personnel carriers and light flamethrower vehicles, 3rd CID is at its best overwhelming the enemy in Phase A, when anti-tank threat is still minimal.\nBut with its own anti-tank capacity only improving in Phase C, the Canadians can expect a hard time in Phase B.

REFTEXT: THE FIREBUG
第3降下猟兵師団は,主に最も優れた火器を装備した多くのエリート空挺兵に依存している.彼らの火力がたとえ比類無きものでも,彼らは,極めて軽い支援しか受ける事ができない.フェーズAでは最善を尽くす.\n降下猟兵は,白兵戦の相手としては最も致命的だが,開豁地では効果的ではない.ルフトヴァッフェの大規模な支援だけが彼らの侵攻を手助けするだろう.
CLASSEMENT: 3. FJ relies mainly on a large number of elite paratroopers equipped with the best infantry weapons. Although their firepower is unmatched, they can only rely on very light support, and are at their best in Phase A.\nFallschirmjägers are the deadliest opponents one can face in close combat, but will be much less effective on an open terrain. There, only the massive support of the Luftwaffe will help them progress.

REFTEXT: 多くの空挺師団ユニットは(翼のアイコンがついている)は包囲されない事を覚えておけ.
CLASSEMENT: Remember that many airborne division's units (identified by wings on their cards) can't be surrounded. Or at least, if they are, they don't care…

REFTEXT: THE ELITE
フェーズAから中戦車が使用可能で,歩兵は常に装甲車両で到着する,'Spearhead'は,市街戦には適していないが,開豁地では優れた火力を享受する.\nフェーズB,Cは,重装甲のJumboと, 砲改良型のM4A3(76)を含むM4A3の大群が,敵を激しい圧力の元におくだろう.
CLASSEMENT: With medium tanks available right from Phase A, and infantry always arriving with armored transport, 'Spearhead' is not well suited for urban warfare but it enjoys superior firepower in open terrain.\nIn Phase B & C, swarms of M4A3 tanks, including the heavily armored Jumbo and upgunned M4A3(W)76, will keep the enemy under an increasing pressure.

REFTEXT: THE STEAMROLLER
第4機甲師団は,重装備の第3機甲師団とは対照的に,旧式で少数の戦車を装備した軽機甲師団として組織された.\nしかし,積極的な偵察部隊と,敵よりも上手に立ち回れる高機動力を持ったヘルキャット駆逐戦車隊が,特にフェイズAとBに割り当てられる.
CLASSEMENT: Organized as a « light » armored division, 4th Armored has fewer tanks and of older models than its « heavy » counterpart the 3rd Armored.\nBut it relies on aggressive cavalry scouts and an attached battalion of highly mobile light Hellcat tank destroyers to outmanoeuvre the enemy, especially in Phase A & B.

REFTEXT: THE COBRA
第4カナダ機甲師団は,英国と米国間のミッシングリンクである.前者として編成されたが,装備は完全に後者仕様であった.その本来の特徴は, シャーマン中戦車?!を配備した,装甲偵察連隊を指揮下に置く連合軍唯一の師団である.
CLASSEMENT: 4th CAD is the missing link between a British and an American armored division : organized as the former, it is entirely equipped by the latter. Its main original feature is that it is the only Allied division with an armored recon regiment entirely equipped with … Sherman medium tanks !

REFTEXT: THE MISSING LINK
軽戦車と,艦砲射撃に支援されたエリート歩兵を,第6空挺師団はフェーズAから所有する.\nしかしフェーズBから,17ポンド砲と航空支援で,戦線を維持しなければならない.
CLASSEMENT: With elite infantry supported by airborne light tanks and naval artillery, 6th Airborne owns Phase A.\nBut from Phase B, it must hold the conquered ground with its 17-pdr and air support.

REFTEXT: 多くの空挺師団ユニットは(翼のアイコンがついている)は包囲されない事を覚えておけ.
CLASSEMENT: Remember that many airborne division's units (identified by wings on their cards) can't be surrounded. Or at least, if they are, they don't care…

REFTEXT: THE DEVIL

Created as part of the Guard Armoured Division, the 6th GAB was made an independant brigade when the latter was reorganized according ot the new armored division's TO&E in 1942. As such and equipped with Churchill, it fought in the latter stages of the Normandy campaign, then NW-Europe, finishing the war in Lubeck where it had accomplished the unsual feat of capturing a U-Boat.
CLASSEMENT: Created as part of the Guard Armoured Division, the 6th GAB was made an independant brigade when the latter was reorganized according ot the new armored division's TO&E in 1942. As such and equipped with Churchill, it fought in the latter stages of the Normandy campaign, then NW-Europe, finishing the war in Lübeck where it had accomplished the unsual feat of capturing a U-Boat.

REFTEXT: THE????
CLASSEMENT: THE ???

REFTEXT: 第716歩兵師団は,前大戦(Great War)で親父達がしたように最高の戦いをする: MGとライフルで陣地を形成し,砲兵支援を受け,支援戦車の下に突撃するのみ.
CLASSEMENT: 716. ID's soldiers are at their best fighting as their fathers did in the Great War: by forming a strongpoint around MGs and infantry guns, supported by artillery, and only advancing under cover of infantry tanks.

REFTEXT: 敵の進撃を打破するためには,早いうちに予備の88mm多目的砲と航空支援に頼る必要がある.
CLASSEMENT: With few effective anti-tank assets in reserve, 716. ID must rely on early available 88mm dual-purpose guns and air support to break enemy advances and progress itself.

REFTEXT: THE OLD-TIMER
第7機甲師団のクロムウェルは他師団のシャーマンよりも強靭さが欠けている,彼らはそれを機動性で補っている: デザートラッツは,他よりもより素速く攻撃し,常に場所を変えている,彼らは受ける被害以上に打撃を加える.もしも彼らがクロムウェルに完璧に習熟してなかったら,砂漠で旧装備を使っていたら同様に光り輝いてはいない.
CLASSEMENT: What 7th Armoured's Cromwells lack in resilience over other divisions' Shermans, they're making up for with mobility: the Desert Rats are made to strike fast and to always keep moving. More than any other, they are better at dealing the blow than receiving it. If they are not entirely familiarised with the Cromwell, the opposite can be said for the older equipment used in the desert, with which they truly shine.

REFTEXT: THE QUICK
フェーズAで,第91空輸歩兵師団は,エリート部隊と共に敵を攻撃している間,戦線を維持する為に,他の事を考えずに二戦級部隊と支援戦車を犠牲にすることができる.\nフェーズB,Cで,その優位性は失われるが,師団はルフトヴァッフェによる大規模で多目的な支援に頼ることができる.
CLASSEMENT: In Phase A, 91. Luftlande can sacrifice second-rate troops & infantry tanks without a second thought to hold the line, all the while striking elsewhere with elite troops.\nIt loses its edge in Phase B & C, although the division can rely on the massive and versatile support of the Luftwaffe.

REFTEXT: THE MONGREL

第9装甲師団は,装備と人員を再編成している過程のまま個別にノルマンディ戦線に投入された.将兵の一部は未だ東部戦線で戦っており,夏至の頃にノルマンディ戦線に参加するためロシアを離れた.\n装甲部隊を失い旧式の装備で戦ったとはいえ,第9装甲師団は戦闘に慣れた熟練兵と,すぐに目をくらます異常に多い軽戦車で敵を圧倒することを頼みの綱としている.\nそしてフェイズが進んでいくと,東部戦線から来たばかりの更に熟練した部隊を利用可能となる.
CLASSEMENT: 9. Panzer went into combat in Normandy piecemeal and while still in the process of re-completing men & equipment. Some of its men were even still fighting in the East, only leaving Russia to join the fight in Normandy in mid-Summer. \nAlthough missing its Panther battalion and still fighting with old equipment, the 9. Panzer relies on battle-hardened troops and an unusually high number of light tanks to quickly blind and overwhelm the enemy.\nAnd with each passing phase, more experienced troops are made available, arriving straight from the East.

REFTEXT: THE HUSSAR
コマンドー旅団は大部分をエリート歩兵からなり,少数の戦車と,彼らを支援する更に僅かな対戦車砲しか持たないが,引き替えに大規模な艦砲と艦隊航空支援を受けられる.\nフェイズAでは強力だが,フェイズBでのポイント収入の落ち込みにより,攻撃の手を休めて,第79機甲部隊の全面支援を受けるまで持ちこたえることに苦労させられる.
CLASSEMENT: The Commando Brigade relies mostly on its elite infantry, with few tanks and even less AT guns to back them up, trading those for massive naval artillery and Fleet Air Arms support.\nStrong in Phase A, the Commandos are suffering from a major income drop in Phase B, having to « hold until relieved » to go back on the offensive in Phase B, with the full support of the 79th Armoured's troops.

REFTEXT: まさに,このような空挺師団,翼のマークがカードに付けられたコマンド部隊は包囲されない.いや,もしそうなったとしても,少なくとも彼らは気にならない･･･
CLASSEMENT: Just like airborne divisions, commando units identified by wings on their cards can't be surrounded. Or at least, if they are, they don't care…

REFTEXT: THE FEW
ほんのわずかな(ほとんどが鹵獲した)装甲車両,野砲と対空砲,DBSASは,一方で数は多いが貧弱で軽火器を手にしたFFIパルチザンに頼り、もう一方はSASに訓練された少数精鋭の降下兵を頼りにしている.主となる補給は連合軍の長距離航空支援によって行われている.
CLASSEMENT: The DBSAS has very little armoured artillery support & AA of its own, and has to make do for some time with a few captured German vehicles & guns. In Phase A, it can rely on a high number of cheap and very lightly equipped FFI partisans and a few non-German Wehrmacht deserters providing some trained troops. In Phase B comes the small core of highly aggressive SAS-trained paratroopers. In Phase C, relief arrives in the form of Patton's armoured vanguard, acting like the cavalry of the old cowboy movies. The DBSAS doesn't fight in the usual way, and it doesn’t care much about the frontline.

REFTEXT: 多くの降下兵師団部隊(羽アイコンを持った兵)は包囲されることはないことを覚えておくこと。もしそうなっても、彼らは気にも止めない・・・
CLASSEMENT: Remember that many airborne divisions’ units (identified by wings on their cards) cannot be surrounded. Or at least, if they can be, then they don't care…

REFTEXT: THE PARTISAN
パリを手中に収める戦いで,これ以上にミスマッチな戦闘集団はありません.薄く広く選ばれた,二線級部隊と個々のエリート部隊,即席の戦闘部隊とするために,全体から少しずつ提供した.フランスの首都を滅ぼせんがために連合軍を破壊すべき,von Choltitzは要求し,手に入れた 大勢の爆撃機と,非常に強力な'Karl'600mm臼砲の指揮をもって,都市を瓦礫の山へと変えるべく…
CLASSEMENT: There is hardly a more mismatched battlegroup than the one fighting for Paris. With a wide array of choices, from a lot of second-rate troops to individual elite units, it offers a little bit of everything that can be cobbled together into a fighting unit. In order to be able to destroy the French capital city should it fall to the Allies, von Choltitz requested, and obtained, command of a large number of bombers and even the dreaded 'Karl' super-heavy (600mm!) mortar to reduce the city to a pile of ruins…

REFTEXT: THE PATCHWORK
近衛部隊は,双方共に優れた装備を持った,多くの戦車と歩兵を組み合わせている. クロムウェルはフェーズAから,ファイアーフライはフェーズBから,それは時が経つとより強力になる.\nしかし,コストはフェーズCに向けて,着実に増加する傾向があるため,早い段階で選択を行う必要がある.
CLASSEMENT: The Guards combine numerous tank and infantry, both of good quality. With Cromwell from Phase A and Firefly from Phase B, it grows more powerful with each passing moment.\nYet its economy tends to favour a steady progression towards Phase C, hence choices will have to be made earlier on.

REFTEXT: THE GENTLEMEN
わずかな軽車両だけと,コスト的に弱い為,フェーズAでは,レーアは忍耐強くなければならない.\nフェーズBから改良が始まるが,まだコストもかかる.\n 一方,フェーズCは,非常に良いコストに支えられ,最重量級の最新車両と共に,ドイツのアーセナルの水門を開く.
CLASSEMENT: With only a few light vehicles and a weak economy in Phase A, Lehr has to be patient.\nIt starts to improve in Phase B, yet still with a wanting economy.\nPhase C, on the other hand, opens the floodgates of the German arsenal, with all the heaviest and latest vehicles, backed by a very good economy.

REFTEXT: THE HAMMER
火炎放射器
CLASSEMENT: Flamethrower

REFTEXT: 戦闘機
CLASSEMENT: FIGHTER

REFTEXT: 対戦車分隊
CLASSEMENT: Anti-Tank Team

REFTEXT: 偵察分隊
CLASSEMENT: Recon Squad

REFTEXT: 軽機関銃
CLASSEMENT: LMG

REFTEXT: 中機関銃
CLASSEMENT: MMG

REFTEXT: 迫撃砲
CLASSEMENT: Mortar

REFTEXT: 第二次世界大戦においてノルマンディで戦闘経験を持つアメリカ合衆国陸軍師団長の一人
CLASSEMENT: One of the few American division commanders with WW2 combat experience in Normandy.

REFTEXT: エンジニア,騎兵,外交官,秘密諜報員,職員という経歴を持ったテイラーは,1944年初頭,英国で第101空挺師団を任される優秀な兵士でした.\n彼はバストーニュの戦い以外の全ての戦闘で師団を率いていた(その時は米国にいた).\n大戦後，彼はベトナムにおける米国の関与拡大に大きな役割を果たした.
CLASSEMENT: Having already been an engineer, artilleryman, diplomat, secret agent and staff officer, Taylor was a consummate soldier when given command of the 101st Airborne in England in early 1944.\nHe went on leading the division in all its battles but Bastogne (being on leave in the USA at the time).\nAfter the war, he played a major role in the increasing US involvement in Vietnam.

REFTEXT: マクスウェル・ダヴェンポート・テイラー
CLASSEMENT: Maxwell TAYLOR

REFTEXT: 貴族のグラフト（伯爵）ゲルトフォンシュヴェリーンは,東部戦線において熟練したカリスマ的歩兵指揮官であることが証明された.この戦争にドイツが勝つという彼の希望は，ノルマンディに到着したときに失なわれた.
CLASSEMENT: An aristocrat, Graf (Count) 'Gert' von Schwerin had proven himself to be a skilled and charismatic infantry commander on the Russian front, but any hope of Germany winning the war was lost to him by the time he arrived in Normandy.

REFTEXT:
フォンシュヴェリーンの経歴は,第一次世界大戦最後の年,19歳の時に,カイザー祖国防衛隊から始まった.
当初から反ナチスだった彼は,戦争が起きる前にヒトラーについての警告を英国情報部にしようとしたが,役に立てなかった.
それにもかかわらず,彼は第二次世界大戦中,フランス,北アフリカ,ロシア戦線でドイツ軍に仕え,1942年後半に自己の師団を与えられる前までに,多くの戦功を立てた.
1944年,戦争は終わったと確信し,7月20日の作戦会議に関与(少なくとも知って)いたシュヴェリーンは,ヒトラーに対して難色を示し,ノルマンディーのモルタン(リュティヒ)においての絶望的な反撃作戦では熱意を表さなかった.
ドイツ国境への退却後,彼は無駄な破壊を避け,アーヘンを連合国軍に明け渡そうとしたことがナチスに気づかれ,彼は更迭された.
CLASSEMENT:
Von Schwerin started his career, aged 19, in the Kaiser's Guard during the last year of WW1. An anti-Nazi from the start, he tried to warn British intelligence about Hitler before the war, but to no avail.
Nevertheless, he served in the German military during WW2, in France, North Africa and the USSR, distinguishing himself on several occasions before being given command of his own division in late 1942.
In 1944, convinced that the war was lost, Schwerin was involved in (or at least aware of) the 20th July plot against Hitler, and thus showed no zeal in conducting Hitler's desperate counter-attack at Mortain in Normandy.
After the retreat to the German border, he tried to deliver Aachen to the Allies without useless destruction, but his attempt was discovered by the Nazis, who had him relieved.

REFTEXT: ゲアハルト・フォン・シュヴェリーン
CLASSEMENT: Gerhard Graf VON SCHWERIN

REFTEXT:
マイヤーは,1939年から1943年にかけて, エリート部隊 第1SS装甲師団'ライプシュタンダルテ・ＳＳ・アドルフ・ヒトラー'（ヒットラー護衛部隊）に参加し,素早く考え迅速な作戦行動に移す精神から'シュネラーマイヤー'(スピーディマイヤー)のニックネームを得た.
1943年,彼は新設された第12SS装甲師団'ヒトラーユーゲント'の第25装甲擲弾兵連隊長に転任した.1944年6月6日部隊はノルマンディーに到着した.
前任者が英国の砲撃で殺されてから１週間しないうちに,彼は師団長に任命された.
1944年夏,彼は,少数の隊員と共に果敢に反撃を行い,わずかながら失った領土を取り戻し,ノルマンディにおいて,最も連合国軍に敵対する決意を秘めた相手の一人であることを証明した.
CLASSEMENT: Meyer took part in all the elite 1. SS-Panzer Division 'Leibstandarte SS Adolf Hitler' (Hitler's own bodyguard) campaigns from 1939 to 1943, earning the nickname 'Schneller Meyer' (Speedy Meyer) for his quick thinking and dashing spirit.\nIn 1943, he was transferred to the newly formed 12. SS-Panzer Division 'Hitlerjugend' as commander of Panzer-Grenadier-Regt. 25, and it was in this position that he arrived in Normandy on June 6th, 1944.\nHe was appointed as commander of the whole division a mere week later, when his predecessor was killed in a British artillery barrage.\During the Summer of 44, he proved himself one of the most determined opponents the Allies faced in Normandy, aggressively counter-attacking with any handful of men he could gather to retake any inch of lost ground.

REFTEXT: 一番若いドイツ師団長の一人である'パンツァーマイヤー'は,彼の積極的な精神と迅速な思考,そして前線(よく最前線で,ときどき越えて)で指揮をすることで知られていた.
CLASSEMENT: « PanzerMeyer », one of the youngest German divisional commanders, was known for his aggressive spirit and quick thinking, and for commanding from the front (often too close, sometimes even beyond it).

REFTEXT: クルト・マイヤー
CLASSEMENT: Kurt MEYER

REFTEXT: 彼の上官は,ノルマンディーでの最高の師団長では無いにせよ,その一人とみなし,オドン攻略の功績の殆どは彼によるものとした.
CLASSEMENT: His superior considered MacMillan one of the best, if not THE best, division commanders in Normandy, and attributed to him most of the merits of the Odon offensive.

REFTEXT:
マクミランは,第一次世界大戦で大殺戮(ソンメ,パッシェンデール,アラス,…)を無傷でくぐり抜け,英国軍でもっとも勲章を受けた中尉の一人として終戦を迎えた.
彼が第二次世界大戦で最初に戦闘を見たのは,1943年にフランス領アルジェリアに連合軍として従軍したのち,6ヶ月後のシチリア侵攻では旅団を率いた.
彼はこの戦役中にもう一度顕著な戦果をあげたので,英国で第15（スコットランド）歩兵師団の指揮官に昇進した.
彼はヨーロッパへの侵攻に備えて1年間訓練したが,ノルマンディーに上陸したのは７日後だった.
しかし,彼の師団は,オドンを横切り,悪名高い112高地へ向かう,モントゴメリー攻勢の重要な役割を果たすだろう.
CLASSEMENT:
MacMillan passed unscathed through some of WW1’s worst carnage (Somme, Passchendaele, Arras, …), ending the war as one of the most decorated lieutenants in the British Army.
He first saw combat in WW2 participating in the Allied landing in French Algeria in 1943, then was given field command six months later, leading a brigade in the invasion of Sicily.
He was once again distinguished for his performance during this campaign, and promoted to take command of the 15th (Scottish) Infantry Division in England.
He trained for a year in preparation for the invasion of Europe, but only landed in Normandy on D+7. Yet his division will play a key role in Montgomery's offensive across the Odon and towards the infamous Hill 112.

REFTEXT: サー・ゴードン・マクミラン
CLASSEMENT: Sir Gordon MacMILLAN

REFTEXT: 伝説的な第一次世界大戦における歩兵指揮官,ジーファースは,彼の部隊が防御網の背後に配置され,敵を待つような役目を負うとき,より心配なくこなす.
CLASSEMENT: A traditional WW1 infantry commander, Sievers is more at ease in a defensive role, deploying his men behind a strong defensive screen to wait for the enemy.

REFTEXT: 第一次世界大戦のベテランであると同時に,ジーファースは,第二次世界大戦が勃発した1939年当時は陸軍中佐であった.オランダとフランスでの戦役に従軍したあとは,彼は1940年から1943年後半まで,占領下にあったフランスでの占領実務と,メッツの兵学校校長として仕え,同時期に東部戦線を二期務めている.1943年11月,ヒトラーは空軍野戦師団を陸軍に移管し,それらの空軍将校たちを陸軍士官に置き換え,ジーファースは後者のうちの一人として,第16空軍野戦師団の指揮官に任命された.空軍野戦師団は陸軍の標準的な構成をとりこんだ.7月3日ノルマンディ,カーン近郊への爆撃で,将兵の75%が戦死し,ジーファースは悲しみで狂人に近いと報告された.しかしながら,大戦後半には他の師団を与えられたジーファースには,カーン陥落の多くの責任があるとされた.
CLASSEMENT: A WW1 veteran as well, Sievers was an infantry lieutenant-colonel when WW2 broke in 1939. After taking part in the campaigns in the Netherlands & France, he served from 1940 to late 1943 in occupation duties in France and as commander of the War School in Metz, with two tours on the Eastern front during that period. On November 1943, Hitler handed the Luftwaffe-Felddivisionen to the Heer (Army), which replaced several Air Force divisional commanders with Army ones. Sievers was one of the latter, being appointed as commander of the 16. Luftwaffe-Felddivision with the task of bringing it to Army standards. With 75% of his men killed in a single bombardment near Caen in Normandy on July 3rd, Sievers was reported as nearly demented with grief. Although being given another division later in the war, Sievers was held by many as responsible for the fall of Caen.

REFTEXT: カール・ジーファース
CLASSEMENT: Karl SIEVERS

REFTEXT: オステンドルフは,第2SS装甲師団'ダスライヒ'のベテランで,兵科を組み合わせた反撃に特化した果敢な歩兵指揮官だ.
CLASSEMENT: Ostendorff was a veteran from 2. SS-Panzer Division 'Das Reich', an aggressive infantry commander specialised in combined arms counter-attacks.

REFTEXT:
オステンドルフは,1925年に軍隊に入隊する以前,東プロイセンの共産主義者と対峙するドイツ義勇軍兵として,２つの大戦間に初めて戦闘を経験した.
彼は当初,ドイツ空軍に配属されたのち,最終的には1928年武装親衛隊へ転任した.
有能な兵士だったオステンドルフは,多くの戦友よりも多くの役目を果たした: 兵士,インストラクター,パイロット,航空オブザーバー,情報諜報員,対空司令官,部隊＆部隊の先任
東部戦線において,とりわけ第三次ハリコフ攻防戦で顕著な功績をあげたので,彼は,新設された第17SS装甲擲弾兵師団'ゲッツ・フォン・ベルリヒンゲン'の師団長に任命され,部隊を率いてノルマンディに赴任した.
カランタンで米国第101空挺師団と対峙した彼は,敵が米第2機甲師団のタイムリーな増援を受けられないとみて,一連の反撃作戦を発動し,もう少しで街を再奪還するところだった.
数日後に激しい負傷を負い,オステンドルフは'ダスライヒ'の最後の師団長として終戦を迎える１週間前に負傷が原因で死んでしまった.
CLASSEMENT:
Ostendorff first fought in the Interwar Freikorps against communist groups in East Prussia, before enlisting in the army in 1925. He initially transferred to the Luftwaffe, and finally transferred to the SS in 1938.
A consummate soldier, Ostendorff served in more roles than many of his counterparts: infantryman, instructor, pilot, aerial observer, intelligence officer, anti-aircraft commander, divisional & corps' chief of staff...
Distinguishing himself on the Russian Front, especially at the (third) battle of Kharkov, he was promoted to commander of the newly formed 17. SS-Panzergrenadier-Division which he led in Normandy.
Facing the American 101st Airborne in the Carentan sector, he launched a series of counter-attacks which came close to recapturing the city, had not the Americans received the timely reinforcements of their 2nd Armored Division.
Wounded a few days later, Ostendorff would later be the last commander of 'Das Reich', and would die of his wounds one week before the end of the war.

REFTEXT: ヴェルナー・オステンドルフ
CLASSEMENT: Werner OSTENDORFF

REFTEXT: 下士官からアメリカ占領下の司政官にまで昇進した農家の青年で,ヒューブナーは規律に厳格であり,もっとも勲章を授けられた米国陸軍将軍の一人である.
CLASSEMENT: A farm boy who rose from enlisted man to Military Governor of the American Zone in Germany, Huebner was a strict disciplinarian and one of the US Army’s most decorated generals.

REFTEXT: 1910頃,一等兵として志願し,ヒューブナーは,第一次世界大戦にアメリカが巻き込まれる数ヶ月前の,1916年11月に将校に任じられた.フランスへ出兵し,彼は1917年6月創設のオリジナルな ≪Big Red One≫の隊員となった.もっとも若い大佐の一人として大戦を終えたあと,２大大戦の間も軍に残っていた.1943年,アメリカが第二次世界大戦に参戦して以来,指揮をとる事はなかったが,同じく誉れ高く,しかし荒れ狂う,彼が最初の戦いを経験した,第１歩兵師団の指揮を与えられた.部隊を容赦なく鍛えあげた彼は,1945年1月に第５軍の司令官に任命されるまでの間,ノルマンディからヒュルトゲンの森の戦い(エルベ川でソビエト軍と邂逅する)まで部隊を率いた.
CLASSEMENT: Enlisting as a private around 1910, Huebner was commissioned officer in November 1916, a few months before America's involvement in WW1. Shipped to France, he was a member of the original « Big Red One » at its creation in May 1917. Ending the war as one of the youngest American colonels, he remained with the Army in the Interwar. In 1943, although having held no command since the American entry in WW2, he was given command of that same prestigious, but unruly, 1st Infantry Division with which he had first fought. Training it relentlessly, he led it into battle from Normandy to Hurtgen Forest in Germany before being promoted to the head of V. Corps in January 1945, with which he made first contact with the Soviets on the Elbe River.

REFTEXT: クラランス・R・ヒューブナー
CLASSEMENT: Clarence HUEBNER

REFTEXT: 機械化された戦争の先駆者で,ポーランド最高の将軍,カナダ軍の先を進んでいたマチェクの電撃侵攻は,極めてギリギリの所でファーレーズギャップを封鎖した.
CLASSEMENT: A pioneer in motorised warfare, and Poland's best armored general, Maczek's lightning offensive ahead of the Canadians came very close to sealing the Falaise pocket.

REFTEXT:
第一次世界大戦とポーランド戦争のベテラン,マチェクは,兵科を組み合わせた戦闘集団と電撃作戦の先駆者だった
二大戦間も軍に残り,彼の経験は,1938年ポーランド初の自動車化騎兵旅団の指揮官として選ばれる完璧な理由となった.
ポーランドとフランス戦役中，マチェクは並外れた手腕と勇敢さを示したが,ついには,残った戦友と共に英国に避難させられ,連合軍と共に戦う為,再軍備,再編成をおこなった.
1944年7月下旬に,装備不足,戦力不足な師団編成でノルマンディーに上陸したが,ファーレーズの戦いでは,マチェクは第1カナダ軍団の先頭に立ち,実際に,一時はファーレーズポケットの封鎖をして,ドイツ軍の突破攻勢の矛先で戦線を支えた.
CLASSEMENT:
A WW1 and later Polish war veteran, Maczek was a pioneer in combined armed battlegroups and motorised tactics.
Remaining in the army during the Interwar, his experience made him the perfect choice as commander of the first Polish motorised brigade in 1938.
During the campaigns of Poland and France, Maczek displayed outstanding skills and bravery, but was finally forced to seek refuge in the UK with what remained of his men, to reorganise, re-arm and fight amongst the Allies.
Landing in Normandy in late July 1944 with an underequipped and understrength division, Maczek spearheaded the First Canadian Army during the battle of Falaise, actually sealing the pocket for a while and supporting the full brunt of the German breakout offensive.

REFTEXT: スタニスワフ・マチェク
CLASSEMENT: Stanislaw MACZEK

REFTEXT: 彼の経歴の初めから終わりまでLAHの隊員であった,ヴィッシュは もっとも勲章を授けられた Waffen-SSの一人として師団長まで昇進した.
CLASSEMENT: A member of LAH from its creation to the end of his career, Wisch rose to command the division as one of the Waffen-SS' most decorated officers.

REFTEXT: 1930年に親衛隊(SS)に入隊し, ≪テディ≫ヴィッシュは,1933年に創設されたLAHに少尉として加わった.彼はポーランドからカルコフに至るまでの師団全ての戦役に参戦した.階級もあがり,彼は最終的には1943年4月師団を指揮するまでになった,まさにクルスクの戦いのときである.彼はイタリアで,ドイツの元同盟国やパルチザンに対してLAHの指揮をし,そしてノルマンディにおいても連合軍に対して指揮をとった.彼の軍歴は,ファレーズポケットを打ち破る戦闘中に受けた,両足を失うという深刻な負傷によって8月20日に終わった.
CLASSEMENT: Joining the SS in 1930, « Teddy » Wisch joined the LAH as a second lieutenant from its creation in 1933. He took part in all of the division's campaigns from Poland to Karkhov. Rising through the ranks, he finally took command of the division in April 1943, just in time to lead it through the battle of Kursk. He then went on commanding LAH in Italy against Germany's former allies and partisans, then against the Allies in Normandy. His military career ended on August 20th when he was seriously wounded during the battle to break out of the Falaise Pocket, requiring both his legs to be amputated.

REFTEXT: テオドール・ヴィッシュ
CLASSEMENT: Theodor WISCH

REFTEXT: フォイヒティンガーは有能な砲兵将校であったが,しかしより重要な装甲師団の知識も経験も無いのに,誉れ高い指揮官の地位を,ナチ党のコネを通じて手に入れた.
CLASSEMENT: Feuchtinger was an able artillery officer, but without prior experience or knowledge of a Panzer Division, a prestigious command which he had secured through his Nazi connections.

REFTEXT: 第一次世界大戦のベテランであるフォイヒティンガーは,オランダ,ベルギー,ロシアで,1943年まで砲兵将校として従軍し,ナチ党要人との人的関係のおかげで,再編成された第21装甲師団の師団長を与えられた.\nひとつも戦車戦の経験を持たぬ彼は,何人かのベテランの連隊指揮官に師団の一切の指揮を任せた.\nD-Day当日,彼の師団は,唯一迅速に反撃することができる海岸近くに居たがフォイヒティンガーは何処にも見つからない,彼は任務を放棄し,部下にも知らせずパリで娼婦と過ごしていた!ノルマンディに急いで戻らなければ,彼は隣の部隊と協力することを拒否し(階級が上でも),さみだれ式に無謀な反撃を試み,ほとんどが敗走する前でも,彼の師団だけて何とか切り抜けようしたり,孤立させられそうだと感じると逃げ出した.
CLASSEMENT: A WW1 veteran, Feuchtinger fought in the Netherlands, Belgium and Russian campaigns as an artillery officer until 1943 when, thanks to well-placed connections with high-ranking Nazi officials, he was given command of a reformed 21. Panzer Division.\nHaving no experience in armored warfare, he secured the posting to his division of several veteran regimental commanders, and then leant entirely on them to run his division.\nOn D-Day, while his division was the closest to the beaches and the only one able to react immediately, Feuchtinger was nowhere to be found, having slipped to Paris, without notifying his staff, to spend the night with his mistress! Hurrying back to Normandy, he refused to coordinate with his neighbours (even superior in rank), and launched piecemeal and therefore vain counter-attacks, before pretty much abandoning his division to fend for itself, running away when he thought he was about to be cut off.

REFTEXT: エドガー・フォイヒティンガー
CLASSEMENT: Edgar FEUCHTINGER

REFTEXT: 7月下旬にノルマンディに上陸し,ルクレールは猪突猛進なスタイルで有名になったパットン第3軍の先鋭として冷酷に突き進み,敵対するドイツ軍に橋頭堡を築く余裕を与えなかった.
CLASSEMENT: Landing in Normandy in late July, Leclerc became famous for his dashing style, advancing relentlessly ahead of Patton's Third Army and never giving its German opposites time to recover their footing.

REFTEXT:
フィリップ・ド・オートクロクの叙事詩は,1940年フランス陥落の暗い日から始まった.戦いを諦めることを拒否し,彼は自転車でフランスの半分の距離を移動したところで捕虜になったが,どうにか脱出して,ロンドンにいたドゴール将軍に加わった.
戦時仮名として'ルクレール'を名乗り,彼は,フランス西アフリカ植民地の僅か20名足らずの兵士たちを自由フランス軍の自分の指揮下に束ね,イタリア領リビアに戦争をしかけた.
階級は華々しく上がり,ドイツ侵攻のためノルマンディーから自由フランス軍第2機甲師団を率いて向かい,その過程でパリとストラスブールを解放した.
1947年彼の死後,フランス元帥の称号が贈られ,フランス軍最新式のMBTには,彼の名前がつけられている.
CLASSEMENT:
Philippe de Hauteclocque's epic started in the dark days of the Fall of France in 1940. Refusing to give up the fight, he travelled half of France on bicycle, was captured but managed to escape, and then joined de Gaulle in London.
Under the nom de guerre 'Leclerc', he rallied French Western African colonies to Free France with barely twenty men under his command, then brought the war to the Italians in their Libyan colonies.
Rising meteorically through the ranks, he went on leading the 2e DB from the Normandy campaign to the invasion of Germany, liberating Paris & Strasbourg in the process.
Made Marshal of France after his death in 1947, France's latest MBT is named after him.

REFTEXT: フィリップ・ルクレール
CLASSEMENT: Philippe LECLERC

REFTEXT: いつも片メガネをかけた気取った騎兵隊将校,von Luttwitzは厳しい教官であり,完璧な戦力として命令を実行する.優れた学者で,他には負けない騎手,若き男爵 von Luttwitz は,1914年陸軍に一介の一兵卒として入隊した,17才のときである.戦争が終わり,二大大戦間は,エリート 第1Ulhan騎兵連隊の中尉となった.馬への優しさを持っていたため,自動車化への提唱者としてのパイオニアだった.よく兵を気に掛ける教官で,1936年オリンピックのドイツ乗馬チームの監督の地位についたが,金メダルの獲得に失敗したことで数年にわたり不名誉をうけた.
CLASSEMENT: A pompous cavalry officer who is never without his monocle, von Lüttwitz is a harsh trainer of men, shaping his command as the perfect weapon.

REFTEXT: 1941年,彼は第20装甲師団に配属されることで,やっと彼の価値を示すことができ,またたく間に昇進して,1942年後半,ついには師団の指揮を執るようになった.1944年2月1日,師団が東部戦線での損耗から最装備しているさなか,彼は第2装甲師団長に任命され,絶えず訓練を行った.5ヶ月後,連合軍侵攻に即応してノルマンディに送られた時には,第2装甲師団は西部戦線で最もよく訓練され元気のある師団となっており,連合軍の作戦部が最も恐れる師団の一つとなった.
CLASSEMENT: An excellent scholar and competitive horseman, young Baron von Lüttwitz enlisted as a mere private in the army in 1914, aged 17. By the end of the war, he was a lieutenant in the elite 1. Ulhan cavalry regiment, and during the interwar, despite his fondness for horses, became a pioneer and advocate of full motorisation. A well-recognised trainer of men, he was placed in charge of the 1936 Olympics' German riding team, but his failure to win the gold medal earned him several years of disgrace. In 1941 he was posted with the 20. Panzer with which he was finally able to show his worth, quickly rising through the ranks and finally taking command of the division in late 1942. On February 1st, 1944, he was appointed as commander of 2. Panzer Division, which he relentlessly trained as before, while the division was refitting from its losses in Russia. Five months later, when sent to Normandy in response to the Allied invasion, the 2. Panzer was the fittest and best-trained division on the Western Front, and one of the most feared by Allied planners.

REFTEXT: ハインリヒ・フォン・リュットヴィッツ
CLASSEMENT: Heinrich Freiherr VON LÜTTWITZ

REFTEXT: 厳格な先任将校だったロバートソンは,D-Dayに向けて彼の師団能力を猛特訓の末に研ぎ澄ました.
CLASSEMENT: A stern and practical officer, Robertson honed his division's skills through intensive training before D-Day.

REFTEXT:
アメリカ外征軍の青年将校として1918年にちょっとの間フランスで勤務した,ロバートソンは２大戦間を通じて昇進し,1940年大佐にまで昇進した.
1942年5月から戦争の終わりまで,彼は全ての戦闘で'インディアンヘッド'の指揮をとった.
D-Day+1日にノルマンディに上陸した彼の師団は,恐ろしい苦難に直面した:ボカージュ,サンローでの戦い,そしてブレスト要塞攻防戦
ロバートソンはその後,バルジの戦いにおいて主要な役割を果たし,戦争が終わると同時に軍団司令官に昇格した.
CLASSEMENT:
Serving briefly in France in 1918 as a young officer with the A.E.F., Robertson rose through the ranks commanding the Interwar, achieving colonelcy in 1940.
From May 1942, he took command of 'Indianhead', which he led through all its combats up to the end of the war.
Landing in Normandy at D+1, his division faced terrible hardships: the bocage, the fight for Saint-Lô and the siege of 'Fortress Brest'.
Robertson later played a major role in the battle of the Bulge and was promoted to corps command just after the end of the war on the ETO.

REFTEXT: ウォルター・ロバートソン
CLASSEMENT: Walter ROBERTSON

REFTEXT: クライスの守備力は東部戦線で研ぎ澄まされていた,オマハビーチにおいて,彼の師団が米国による２回に渡る最初の攻撃を防いだ事は,もうすこしの所で連合軍のD-Day作戦を挫折させるところだった.
CLASSEMENT: Kraiß's defensive skills, honed on the Russian Front, almost foiled the Allied plans on D-Day when his division stopped cold the first two American waves at Omaha.

REFTEXT:
もう一人の第一次世界大戦のベテラン,クライスは第二次世界大戦でも軍に忠実であり,1941年3月から東部戦線で幾つかの師団の指揮をとった.
1943年後半に,彼はフランスにおいて東部戦線で敗れた複数の師団の残存兵と，新兵から編成した第352歩兵師団の指揮をとった.
クライスはうまく熟練兵と補充兵を１つにまとめることに成功し,彼の師団はD-Dayに備えて,太平洋の壁の正面右翼オマハビーチに配置された.
米国は二線級の守備部隊とだけ遭遇する事を想定していたが,クライスにより,統制がとれよく訓練された部隊によって,彼らは海岸線で虐殺された.しかし一日が終わる頃には,彼の側面が脅かされ,増援も弾薬も尽きかけてきたので部隊を撤退させた
クライスは８月のサンローでの戦いにおいて戦死した.
CLASSEMENT:
Another WW1 infantry veteran, Kraiß remained true to this arm in WW2, commanding several divisions on the Russian Front from March 1941.
In late 1943, he took command of 352. Infantry Division, forming in France from new recruits and remnants of several divisions destroyed in the East.
Kraiß proved successful in merging the veterans and replacements, and his division was inserted in the Atlantic Wall just prior to D-Day, right in front of what would become Omaha Beach.
While the Americans had planned to encounter only second-rate troops manning the defences, they were slaughtered on the beach by Kraiß' well-disciplined and well-trained troops. But by the end of the day, threatened on his flanks and running short of reinforcements and ammo, he had to pull his men off.
Kraiß was killed in August in the Saint-Lô sector.

REFTEXT: ディートリッヒ・クライス
CLASSEMENT: Dietrich KRAIß

REFTEXT: 勇敢な将軍,率直で,部下の面倒見がよく,彼の戦区は,ドイツ軍の最も強い抵抗があるにも関わらず,ケラーは彼の師団を率いて,他の師団よりも一層奥に進出した,オマハビーチを別にすれば
CLASSEMENT: A soldier's general, outspoken and caring for the lives of his men, Keller led his division further inland on D-Day than any other, despite German resistance being strongest in his sector, but for Omaha Beach.

REFTEXT: 'ロッド'ケラーは,大佐として戦争を始め,カナダ軍の拡大と共にめざましく昇進していった.\n1942年9月未評価の第3カナダ歩兵師団の指揮を任され,わずか2年で,彼はこの新兵の寄せ集めを,団結力のあるプロの戦闘集団に生まれ変わらせ,D-Dayにおいて他のどの師団よりも,厳しい戦場にありながら優れた戦果を残すことで,その実力を示した.\nしかし戦闘の重い負担がケラーに犠牲をしいらせ,彼は直ぐに,自分自身は指揮官として不適格と見るようになった.８月に友軍の誤射により怪我を負ってから,彼は自身の師団トップを置き換え,二度と戦場に戻ってくることはなかった.
CLASSEMENT: Rod' Keller started the war as a colonel, before quickly rising through the ranks with the expansion of the Canadian armed forces.\nGiven command of the untested 3rd Canadian Infantry Division in September 1942, in just two years he transformed this motley collection of recruits into a cohesive and professional fighting force, which demonstrated its skill on D-Day by performing better than any other assault division, despite heavy odds.\nBut the strain of combat took its toll on Keller, and he was soon regarded (including by himself) as unfit for command. Wounded by friendly fire in August, he was replaced as the head of his division, never to return to active duty.

REFTEXT: ロドニー・ケラー
CLASSEMENT: Rodney KELLER

REFTEXT: 熟練したカリスマ性を持った指揮官,シェンフは自身の師団を率いて,ノルマンディでは極めて劣勢ながら偉大な効果をあげた.
CLASSEMENT: A skilled and charismatic leader, Schimpf led his division with great effectiveness in Normandy despite heavy odds.

REFTEXT:
第一次世界大戦のベテラン,シェンフは公式記録によると数年前に空軍へ転属になり,ベルサイユ条約違反の訓練を受けたことになっている.
直ぐに階級を上げ,彼は幾つか技術職に就いたのち,第21空軍野戦師団の指揮官につき,一年以上も東部戦線で師団を率いた.
1944年2月に第3降下猟兵師団の指揮官に就き,彼はノルマンディ作戦を通して部隊を率いた.彼の指揮の下では,彼の師団は最も信頼できる師団として格付けされた:ファレーズポケットから絶望的な包囲網突破が試みられている間,第12SS装甲師団 & 第3降下猟兵師団の残存兵だけは,統制と訓練がされたままで残り周りの指揮官達が率いて攻撃をおこなった
とはいえ,シェンフも突破中に深刻な怪我を負い,彼の隊員達は彼を担いで脱出した.
CLASSEMENT:
A WW1 veteran, Schimpf transferred to the air force branch (Luftwaffe) years before it officially existed, still being a secret training program in violation of the Versailles Treaty.
Rising quickly through the ranks, he held several technical and staff positions, until being placed in command of 21. Luftwaffe-Field Division which he led for more than a year on the Russian Front.
Being given command of 3. Fallschirmjäger-Division in February 1944, he led it through the Normandy campaign. Under his leadership, his division ranked among the best and most reliable German ones: during the desperate breakout attempts from the Falaise pocket, only what was left of the 12. SS-Panzer & 3. Fallschirmjäger remained as organised and disciplined units around their leaders to lead the charge.
Although Schimpf was seriously wounded in the breakout, his paratroopers carried him with them in the escape.

REFTEXT: リチャード・シェンフ
CLASSEMENT: Richard SCHIMPF

REFTEXT: 重武装の師団を従えてコタンタン半島の'ヘッジローヘル'を抜け,ワトソンは,このような厳しい環境で戦う,新しい戦術を開発して適応しなければならない.
CLASSEMENT: Leading his heavy division through the Cotentin's 'hedgerow hell', Watson had to adapt and develop new tactics to fight in such a close environment.

REFTEXT:
第一次世界大戦の古参兵,ワトソンは二大戦間に編成された機甲師団に転任し,1940年自身の機甲旅団の指揮をとるまでに昇進した
第3機甲師団の指揮を任せられ,彼はノルマンディ作戦期間中,とりわけサン・ローへ続くボカージュで,その師団を率いてひどい戦闘を戦った.
後に,彼は,ボカージュの国を突破し,ファレーズでの戦闘につながる大きな役目を果たした.
彼は前線の後方で戦車とトラックを停滞させたことにより,アイゼンハワーにより,直ぐに降格,指揮権を剥奪された.しかし戦争の終わり頃までに,将の階級を回復し,歩兵師団を指揮するまでになった.
CLASSEMENT:
A WW1 infantry veteran, Watson transferred to the forming armored forces in the Interwar, rising to command of his own armored regiment in 1940.
Given command of 3rd Armored Division, he led it through the Normandy campaign, especially the vicious fighting in the bocage and for Saint-Lô.
Afterwards, he played a major part in the American breakthrough out of bocage country and in the battle of Falaise.
Yet, he was soon to be demoted and stripped of his command by Eisenhower for having let a major tank and truck jam develop behind the lines. But by the end of the war, he had recovered his general’s stars and was back leading an infantry division.

REFTEXT: リロイ・ワトソン
CLASSEMENT: Leroy WATSON

REFTEXT: スパルタ式な≪タイガージャック≫ウッドは,規範を示すのが良いと信じ,出来るかぎり最前線の近くにいる.遠慮無く物を言い,積極的な指揮官で,彼は,彼の指揮方針や下した命令の結果を非難されることも厭わない.
CLASSEMENT: A Spartan, « Tiger Jack » Wood believed in leading by example, and as close as possible from the front. An outspoken and aggressive commander, he wasn't shy to criticize his commanders' decision or even command style.

REFTEXT: ウェストポイントでは化学の教鞭をとり,第一次世界大戦ではフランスで参謀将校を務め,ウッドは二大戦間のうちに階級を上げ, 第５機甲師団,B戦闘団の指揮をパールハーバーが起きる直前の一ヶ月前まで執った.1942年中期,少将に昇進し,彼は新しく編成された第4機甲師団の指揮官として任命され,来たる戦争に向けての訓練と編成を行った.1944年7月,彼はコブラ作戦の実施期間中,自分の師団を率いて戦い,アヴランシュの主要交差路を奪取しドイツ軍前線を突破してボカージュの国を抜けた.まさに,彼の激しい気性と,初めはブラッドレー次にエディら上司への公然の批判で,1944年12月に彼は師団の指揮権を剥奪される事となった,公式には一時的処置とされたが…彼は二度と戦闘を指揮する事は無かった.
CLASSEMENT: A Chemistry teacher at West Point and WW1 staff officer in France, Wood rose through the ranks during the Interwar, taking command of 5th Armored Division's Combat Command B just one month before Pearl Harbor. In mid-1942, promoted Major General, he was appointed as commander of the newly formed 4th Armored Division with the tasking of organizing & training it for war. In July 1944, he led his division in battle during the exploitation phase of Operation Cobra, capturing Avranches' major crossroad and breaking through the German front and out of bocage country. Yet, his strong temper and open criticisms of his superiors, first Bradley then Eddy, led to him being removed from command of his division in December 1944, officially as a temporary measure … but he never got a combat assignment again.

REFTEXT: ジョン・ウッド
CLASSEMENT: John WOOD

REFTEXT: 量より質の提唱者,ゲイルは,部隊に奇襲を重要視した広範囲な訓練を完璧に行わせることを好んだ.
CLASSEMENT: An advocate of quality over number, Gale favoured extensive training to drill his troops to perfection, with an emphasis on shock manoeuvres.

REFTEXT:
勲章を多く授かったWW1のベテラン,彼は二大戦間中インドにおり,1936年に英国に戻った
上官から良く重用され,ゲイルは1941年に第1空挺旅団の指揮を任され,1943年には新編成した第6空挺師団の指揮官に昇進した.
彼は,D-Dayのいかなる作戦でも完遂できるように,師団をよく訓練し,組織化する為に翌年を費やした.
戦争の後半では,第1空挺軍団の指揮をとった.
CLASSEMENT:
A decorated WW1 veteran, he served in India during the Interwar, only returning to England as major in 1936.
Well-regarded by his superiors, Gale was given command of 1st parachute Brigade upon its formation in 1941, and then was promoted to command the newly formed 6th Airborne Division in 1943.
He spent the next year organising and training his division to accomplish the many missions required of it on D-Day.
Later in the war, he went on to command I Airborne Corps.

REFTEXT: サー・リチャード・ゲイル
CLASSEMENT: Sir Richard GALE

REFTEXT: D-Day当日,リヒターの師団は連合軍の的となったので,素早く配置転換した.彼の粘り強い守りは,最重要作戦目標だったカルピケやカーンへの侵攻を妨害した.
CLASSEMENT: Although Richter's division bore the brunt of the Allied assault on D-Day and was quickly dislocated, his tenacious defence prevented them from seizing their most prized objectives immediately, such as Carpiquet and Caen.

REFTEXT:
第一次世界大戦のベテラン歩兵,リヒターのWW2の戦歴は,ポーランド,フランス,ロシアでの砲兵旅団の指揮官として始まった.
1943年3月フランスにて,彼は第716歩兵師団の指揮を任せられた.師団は,高齢者や前線で病気を患った者で編成されて,ほとんどと言ってほど輸送手段は無かった
彼のWW1の塹壕戦,砲兵戦闘の経験を有効に活用し機関銃と砲兵の支援を重視した一連の強化された部隊を組織した.
彼の準備は,D-Day作戦目的を台無しにするのに十分な程に,連合国の侵攻を遅らせた.最初の1週間の戦闘で,彼の師団は人員の約60％を失い,前線から退却しなければならなかった.
CLASSEMENT:
A veteran WW1 infantryman, Richter started WW2 as an artillery regiment commander in Poland, France & USSR.
In March 1943, he was given command of the 716. Infantry Division in France, a static division formed of men too old or sick for frontline duty, and almost entirely deprived of transport.
Putting his WW1 trench warfare experience and artillery expertise to good use, Richter organised a series of reinforced strongpoints with a strong emphasis on machine-gun nests and artillery support.
His preparations slowed the Allies enough to spoil their D-Day objectives. In the single first week of fighting, his division had lost around 60% of his personnel and had to be retired from the frontline.

REFTEXT: ヴィルヘルム・リヒター
CLASSEMENT: Wilhelm RICHTER

REFTEXT: 第一次世界大戦最後の年からの古参兵,Erskineは二つの大戦に挟まれた期間をインドや中東で任務に従事していた.1941年から,彼は北アフリカで歩兵部隊の大隊長として戦い,際立った功績で昇格していった.1943年1月モントゴメリーによって,第7機甲師団の司令官として指名され,彼は,師団が英国本土に呼び戻されるまで,チュニジアや初期のイタリア戦線で部隊を率いていた.モントゴメリー将軍は,いま計画したノルマンディ侵攻軍の筆頭として, とくに この新しい試みに彼を参加させることを,ErskineとOld Guardに要望した.しかし多くのデザートラッツには, たまに帰郷しつつも5年もの海外派兵で,戦闘疲弊をもたらし,7機甲も鋭さを失った.慣れていない分かりにくいノルマンディのボカージュ,砂漠の古参兵達はヴィレル-ボカージュの洗礼をうける,モントゴメリーが彼らに期待していた機動力を証明できず,およそヴィレル-ボカージュのひと月後,Erskineと約100名程の第7機甲師団の司令官は師団の任務を解かれ転任させられた.その年の後半,彼はベルギーのterritorial commandでしのいだが,大戦の最後には,第43(Wessex)歩兵師団長に返り咲いた.
CLASSEMENT: A veteran from the last year of WW1, Erskine served in India & the Middle East in the Interwar. From 1941, he fought as an infantry battalion commander in North Africa, distinguishing himself and rising through the ranks. Appointed as commander of the 7th Armoured Division by General Montgomery in January 1943, he led it through the Tunisian & early Italian campaigns before the division was recalled to England. General Montgomery, now at the head of the planned invasion forces for Normandy, had especially requested his Old Guard & Erskine to join him in this new endeavour. But for many of the Desert Rats, the return home after up to five years overseas brought with it war weariness, and the 7th lost some of its edge. Unfamiliar with the cramped Normandy bocage, the desert veterans received a beating at Villiers-Bocage, and later on failed to demonstrate the drive that Montgomery expected of them. About one month after Villiers-Bocage, Erskine and about a hundred of the 7th Armoured Division's officers were removed from the division and reassigned. Later that year, Erskine held a territorial command in Belgium, ending the war at the head of a division again: the 43rd (Wessex) Infantry.

REFTEXT: Sir George ERSKINE
ただの大佐に過ぎないが,ほとんどの将校を従えて戦闘のど真ん中で指揮を執った.,ケーニヒは,彼の師団がシェルブールへ撤退することで戦闘の中心を形成した.
CLASSEMENT: A mere colonel, with mostly staff positions behind him, and taking command of a division in the middle of a battle, König gave a good account of himself, his division forming the core of the fighting retreat towards Cherbourg.

REFTEXT: 第一次世界大戦のベテラン,ケーニヒの戦後は市民として暮らし,1937年に軍に復隊した\n第246歩兵師団に仕え,彼はフランスで戦い,二年ほど,そこの駐屯地で任務に就いた後，彼の師団と共に東部戦線へ配置転換した.\n1943年後半,彼は,いくつかの旅団の残党を寄せ集めたカンプグルッペの指揮を任され,軍に呼び戻された.D-Dayが展開するにつれ,戦闘中に将官が負傷したため,彼に第91空輸歩兵師団の指揮を委譲した.
CLASSEMENT:
A WW1 veteran, König returned to civilian life after the war, rejoining the army only in 1937.
Serving with the 246. Infantry Division, he fought in France and stood there in garrison duty for two years before being transferred to the Eastern Front with his division.
In late 1943, he was given command of an ad hoc combat troop gathering remnants of several understrength regiments, then called back in Army Reserve to wait for a new posting.
He didn't have to wait long, for less than a week later, with the D-Day just unfolding, the first general officer casualty of the campaign (Gen. Falley) placed him in command of the 91. Luftlande.

REFTEXT: オイゲン・ケーニヒ
CLASSEMENT: Eugen KÖNIG

REFTEXT: この上ない戦車指揮官,ジョラッセは積極的な前線指揮官で(その証拠に大戦中に6ヶ所の傷を負った),攻撃時も後衛戦でも同じくらいに腕が立った.
CLASSEMENT: A consummated Panzer leader, Jollasse is an aggressive commander leading from the front (as proven by his six wounds received in this war) and as efficient on the offensive as fighting a rearguard action.

REFTEXT: 第一次世界大戦では,歩兵指揮官,戦闘のスペシャリスト,空中観測官を務め,ジョラッセは二大戦間のうちに,極秘のルフトヴァッフェとして民間の教師になった.しかし本当の軍歴は,1934年陸軍に大尉として入隊していた.1939年には中佐になり,1940年後期,新しく創設されソビエトへ侵攻した第18装甲師団へ転籍する前,彼はオランダ,フランス戦役に従軍した.1941年6月28日,ジョラッセのカンプフグルッペは,恐るべきT-34と初めて遭遇したという疑わしい名誉を持っている.大損害を受けたにも関わらず,彼は高性能爆薬を使って何とか戦車を撃退し多くの賞賛を得た.階級は上がり,1943年7月12日に,彼は戦争終了まで率いることになる第9装甲師団の指揮を執る,1944年5月,部隊は休養と補給のためにフランスへ転戦した.彼はノルマンディ戦役の最後まで,その部隊を率いたが,しかし9月に負傷してからは,限定された任務のみとされた.
CLASSEMENT: An infantry officer, combat gaz specialist and aerial observer in WW1, Jollasse became a civilian instructor to the clandestine Luftwaffe in the interwar. But true to his original Army origins, he nonetheless joined the Heer in 1934 as an infantry captain. A lieutenant-colonel in 1939, he took part in the campaign in the Netherlands & France, before transfering to the newly raised 18. Panzerdivision in late 1940, with which he invaded the Soviet Union. On June 28th, 1941, Jollasse's Kampfgruppe had the dubious honor of being the first to encounter the formidable T-34. Despite heavy losses, he managed to repel the tanks with demolition charges, earning much praises. Rising through the ranks, he took command of 9. Panzer on July 12th, 1943 and led it through the rest of the campaign, then transfered to France in March 1944 to rest and refit. He led it in Normandy through the last stage of the campaign, but was wounded in September and declared fit for limited service only.

REFTEXT: アーウイン・ジョラッセ
CLASSEMENT: Erwin JOLLASSE

REFTEXT: 兵士であり,紳士でもある,ロバト卿は,彼のコマンドー部隊を冷静にそして…彼に合うやり方で勇敢に率いた.
CLASSEMENT: A soldier and gentleman, Lord Lovat gallantly leads his commandos with composure and style … and in tune.

REFTEXT: サイモン・フレーザー,第15代ロバト卿は,英国スコットランドの貴族,オックスフォード大学を卒業し,1939年予備役の大尉として召還された.ロバト偵察部隊,彼ら一党からなす自身の連隊についた,1940年,彼は新しく創設されたコマンドー部隊に転属を申し出た.第4コマンド部隊に配属され,彼はロフォーテン(ノルウェイ)とアルドロ(フランス)戦役に従軍した.1942年,第4コマンド部隊を指揮中,ディエップへの上陸に失敗し,部隊は作戦目標完遂の見込みが僅かになったので,彼はかろうじて隊員の殆どを再び乗船させた.第1特殊任務旅団(別名コマンドー旅団,頭文字のSSを嫌ったため)は1944年に創設され,ロバト卿は旅団長の役職を任命された.ソード海岸での第二波とはいえ,ロバト卿のコマンド部隊は,作戦目標を確保するべく内陸部へ侵攻すると,ただちに強烈な抵抗に遭遇した.ロバトは,軍紀に反して,管楽器奏者ビル・ミリンの吹くバグパイプと共に立派に上陸を果たした,ロバトは後に「この事はスコットランド人には当てはまらないのでは?!」という意見であった.ロバトと部下は辛うじてペガサス橋にたどり着いたが,予定より二時間半遅れとなった事にロバト卿は謝罪した.六日後,彼は味方砲兵の誤射により重傷を負ってしまい,彼の戦争は,そこで終了した.
CLASSEMENT: Simon Fraser, 15th Lord Lovat, Scottish peer of the Kingdom, was an Oxford graduate and a young reserve army captain when he was recalled to service in 1939. Posted to his clan's own regiment, the Lovat Scouts, he requested in 1940 a transfer to the newly created Commandos. Attached to No. 4 Commando, he took part in the Lofoten (Norway) and Hardelot (France) raids. During the failed Dieppe landing in 1942, now leading No. 4 Commando, his unit was among the few to complete its objectives and manage to re-embark most of its men. When the 1st Special Service Brigade (aka Commando Brigade, as the commandos hated the SS acronym) was formed in 1944, Lord Lovat was appointed as its brigadier. Although engaging in the second wave at Sword Beach, Lovat's commandos soon encountered tough resistance when penetrating inland to secure their objectives. Lovat famously landed with his piper Bill Millin playing the bagpipes against army regulations, as Lovat was of the opinion that such regulations did not apply to Scotsmen! Later in the day, Lovat and his men managed to reach Pegasus Bridge, two and a half minutes behind schedule – for which Lord Lovat apologised. Six days later, he was seriously wounded by friendly artillery fire, thus ending his involvement in the war.

REFTEXT: ロード・ロバト
CLASSEMENT: Lord LOVAT

REFTEXT: 狂気じみた勇ましさと盲目的服従,古参の降下兵,市街戦と機械化戦に長け,フォン・コルティッツは,疑い無しに,任務を完璧にこなす軍人となった,実際は？
CLASSEMENT: Insanely brave and blindly obedient, an experienced infantryman with airborne, urban fighting & armoured warfare experience, von Choltitz appeared to be the perfect man to carry out any order without question. But, was he really?

REFTEXT: ちょうどWWIの直前にサクソン軍の士官候補生として入隊する(ドイツ第3軍),von Choltitzは二大大戦間は,Reichswehrに留まり,1938年降下兵の中佐だった. 1940年オランダでの戦役に参加し,1941年から1944年までロシアと戦った.戦闘における優れた勇敢さと命令への盲目的従順,彼はイタリアのAnzioで戦っていたときに軍団司令に起用され,それからノルマンディへ移った.パリを破壊する命令に従った冷徹な将軍に見える連合軍に解放させるくらいなら,パリを破壊するという彼の命令に従う冷血な将軍を探していた,ヒトラーは彼をフランス軍事総督として昇進させた.フランスレジスタンの蜂起に直面したとき,コルティッツはパルチザンと交渉し,ほとんど無傷のパリを明け渡した.後に彼が主張したように,ヒトラーの狂気を実現させるためだったのだろうか？それとも,より独断的に,戦争犯罪者としての審判で 保身のために ≪パリの救世主≫として振る舞ったのか?,フランス政府はニュルンベルグ裁判においてその借りを支払い,東部戦線においての彼の戦争犯罪による死刑を防いだ.
CLASSEMENT: Enlisting as a cadet in the Saxon Army (German Third Army) just prior to WWI, von Choltitz remained in the Reichswehr during the Interwar and was a lieutenant-colonel in the airlanding forces in 1938. He took part in the campaigns in the Netherlands in 1940, and fought in the USSR from 1941 to 1944. Distinguished for his bravery in combat and blind obedience to orders, he was promoted to corps command in Italy, where he fought at Anzio and Normandy. Looking for a cold-blooded general who would obey orders to raze Paris to the ground rather than allowing the Allies to liberate it, Hitler personally promoted him to military governor of the French capital. Yet, when faced with the Paris Résistance uprising, Chöltitz negotiated with the partisans and ultimately surrendered the city mostly intact to the Allies. Was it because, as he later claimed, he had come to realise Hitler's madness? Or, more pragmatically, was he trying to save his head in the upcoming war crime trials by styling himself as the « Saviour of Paris »? In any event, the French government paid its debt to him during the Nuremberg Trials, preventing the death sentence from being pronounced for his crimes on the Eastern Front.

REFTEXT: ディートリヒ・フォン・コルティッツ
CLASSEMENT: Dietrich von CHOLTITZ

REFTEXT: 精力家,機甲戦のキャリアとしては遅参者で,ドイツ軍と対峙したときも戦線を張って戦うスタイルだった.
CLASSEMENT: An energetic man, and a latecomer in his career to armored warfare, Adair led his division in a frontal style against the Germans.

REFTEXT:
第一次世界大戦の近衛部隊では,既に中尉だった,1940年英国外征軍と共にアデアはフランスに帰ってきた
1942年9月,彼は新たに編成された近衛機甲師団の指揮を任され,ヨーロッパ侵攻作戦参加のために取っておいた.
D-Dayの3週間後にノルマンディに上陸し,彼の師団は,グッドウッド作戦,ブルーコート作戦の厳しい戦いに関わってきた.
その後,彼はブリュッセルを解放し,マーケットガーデン作戦中は英国地上部隊の先頭を率いていた
CLASSEMENT:
Already a lieutenant in the Guards in WW1, Adair was back in France with them in 1940 with the B.E.F.
In September 1942, he was given command of the newly formed Guards Armoured Division, earmarked for participation in the invasion of mainland Europe.
Landing in Normandy three weeks after D-Day, his division was involved in the heavy fighting of Operations Goodwood & Bluecoat.
Later, he liberated Brussels and led the spearhead of the British ground offensive during Market Garden.

REFTEXT: サー・アーラン・アデア
CLASSEMENT: Sir Allan ADAIR

REFTEXT: バイエルラインは,より熟練した,威勢の良い戦線指揮官よりも冷静だった.彼は,戦争の最初から最後まで仕えた,幾人かのドイツ軍指揮官のうちの一人だった.
CLASSEMENT: Bayerlein was more of a skilled and cold-minded Panzer specialist than a dashing frontline commander. He was one of the few German commanders to have served in almost every stage of the war.

REFTEXT: 第一次世界大戦でのベテラン,バイエルラインは二大戦間は参謀将校で,第二次世界大戦の初戦からは,まさに,グーデリアン将軍とロンメルに仕えていた.\n1943年,彼は東部戦線において第3装甲師団の指揮を任された,ヒットラーからの「立ち止まって戦え」という命令に反抗し,部隊率いて包囲網を突破して,かろうじて部隊を救い出した.この功績が讃えられ,彼はエリート部隊である装甲教導師団'パンツァーレーア'の指揮官の地位を褒賞して与えられた.けれども彼は,この'重武装'師団が,最も良い能力を出せないノルマンディの接戦で無駄に消耗するのを嫌がった.\nバイエルラインは命令違反も厭わなかった,特に,軍事的に不合理で無謀な命令には:彼は,彼の師団区域内のハンガリー系ユダヤ人の国外追放に抵抗し,ドイツ軍の方針である焦土作戦の実施を拒絶した.とりわけ彼と,彼の家族の身を危険にしたのは,ルール地方に居る時「死守せよ」という命令の代わりに,軍団ごと組織的に降伏したことだった.
CLASSEMENT: A WW1 veteran, Bayerlein was a staff officer during the Interwar, and served in the early campaigns of WW2 under none other than General Guderian & Rommel.\nIn 1943, he was given command of 3. Panzer Division on the Russian Front, which he managed to save from an encirclement, leading it in a breakout against Hitler's order to stand and fight… and was rewarded with command of the elite Panzer-Lehr for that feat! Yet he resented this 'heavy' division being wasted in the close-fighting in Normandy, where it couldn't give the best account of itself.\nBayerlein never shied away from transgressing orders, especially those that he considered militarily absurd or inhuman: he resisted the deportation of Hungarian Jews from his division's sector, refused to apply the scorched-earth policy in Germany, and despite threat against his life and that of his family's, organised the mass surrender of his troops in the Ruhr instead of having them fight and die to the end.

REFTEXT: フリッツ・バイエルライン
CLASSEMENT: Fritz BAYERLEIN

REFTEXT: 市民兵は磁石のように弾丸を引き付け,常に運良く免れる,≪一本足≫の戦い方:隠密行動をとって素早く強力に攻撃し,安全に離脱する.
CLASSEMENT: A citizen-soldier attracting bullets like a magnet but always cheating death, the « One-Armed Man » fights the SAS way: using stealth to strike fast and hard, then retreating to safety.

REFTEXT: ピア・ルイス・ブルゴは兵士になるつもりは無かった:フランス領ウバンギ・シャリ (現在の中央アフリカ共和国)で教師を勤め,ハンターでもあり,1940年ロンドンのドゴール将軍の最初のそれで有ったにも関わらず,アフリカの自由フランス軍に戻っている, 彼は1941年シリアで戦ったとき,初めて多くの傷を受けた.空軍へ転向し, 3ヶ月後,飛行中の事故により,彼は再び足に深刻な怪我を負った.回復すると,彼は英諜報部の降下教習課程を完了し,チュニジアでの特殊部隊強襲に参加した:いくつかの妨害工作に成功した後,彼の乗った車両がドイツ軍航空機による機銃掃射を受け,37箇所の怪我と,右足を切断するはめになった.ついたニックネームが ≪Le Manchot≫ (≪一本足≫),1944年11月第4SAS連隊の士気を執った.ハンディキャップにも関わらず,ブルゴはパラシュートによる降下を主張した,青白赤(英国人の友人から贈られた)と兵達と共に,1944年6月18日のサン＝マルセルの戦いまで,SASとFFIの指揮を執り続けた.
CLASSEMENT: Pierre-Louis Bourgoin wasn't meant to be a soldier: a school teacher in French Oubangui-Chari (now Central African Republic) and a big game hunter, he was nevertheless among the first to join General de Gaulle in London in June 1940. Returning to Africa with the Free French infantry, he fought in Syria in 1941 where he received the first of many wounds. Transferred to the Air Force, he was shot once more in the leg while flying, and seriously wounded in a crash three months later. Once healed, he undertook a parachute course with the British Intelligence Service, and took part in commando raids in Tunisia. After several successful sabotage operations, his vehicle was strafed by a German plane, leaving him with 37 wounds and an amputated right arm. Nicknamed « Le Manchot » (« One-Armed Man ») from then on, in November 1944 he took command of the 4th SAS Regiment which was meant to be dropped in Brittany 24H before D-Day to distract German troops there from reinforcing the Normandy front. Despite his handicap, Bourgoin insisted in being dropped by parachute (a blue-white-red one – a gift from his British friends) with his men, and went on to command the SAS & FFI troops during the battle of Saint-Marcel on June 18, 1944.

REFTEXT: ピア・ルイス・ブルゴ
CLASSEMENT: Pierre-Louis BOURGOIN

REFTEXT: 戦線からの指揮官,ヴィットは彼の上官である'パウル・ハウサー'が言う所によると「良い指揮官の典型で障害があっても決して怯まない」
CLASSEMENT: A leader from the front, Witt was described by his superior Paul Hausser as « the prototype of the good leader, never backing off in front of an obstacle ».

REFTEXT: ヴィットは,1933年初頭に武装親衛隊に入隊して,ポーランド侵攻,フランスの戦いを,SS'ドイチュラント'として戦争に参加し,着実に階級を上げていった.ギリシャにいた時,大隊長だった彼は,クリディ・パスの戦いで戦線を突破し,ギリシャハートランドへの道を開く,最も目覚しい働きをした.まだ彼の連隊が,SS装甲師団'ダスライヒ'の一部だった時,彼は東部戦線,特にロストフ&カルコフに参加し,さらなる昇進を手に入れた.1943年8月に,新規編成された,第12SS装甲師団の指揮を任され,ほぼ一年間を部隊の確立と訓練に費やしたが,戦闘する機会は与えられずにいた: 彼の師団は,なんとか翌週にノルマンディに到着した.彼は,1944年6月14日司令部のすぐ外で,連合軍の艦砲によって戦死した.
CLASSEMENT: Witt enlisted in the SS as early as 1933 and fought during the campaign of Poland and France with the SS 'Deutschland' regiment, steadily rising through the ranks. But it was in Greece, then a battalion commander that he distinguished himself most, breaking through the Klidi pass and opening the way to the Greek heartland. Still with his regiment, now part of SS division 'Das Reich', he took part in the Russia campaign, especially at Rostov & Karkhov, earning more promotions. Given command of the newly formed 12. SS-Panzerdivision in August 1943, he built and trained it for almost a year. But he wasn't given the opportunity to lead it in combat: barely a week after arriving in Normandy with his division, he was killed on June 14th, 1944, in an allied naval bombardment just outside his HQ.

REFTEXT: フリッツ・ヴィット
CLASSEMENT: Fritz WITT

CLASSEMENT: Infantry divisions rely heavily on cheap and numerous infantry, infantry tanks & artillery.\nLess mobile than more mechanised ones, they can slowly grind an enemy to death.

REFTEXT: 空挺師団は極めて軽装備で,主にエリート部隊と,敵主戦線の背後でも活動できる能力に頼っている.\n彼らは対戦車能力に欠けているとはいえ,空挺兵はほとんど全ての敵に対処できる多目的ユニットで,完全な航空支援をあてにできる.
CLASSEMENT: Airborne divisions are very lightly equipped, relying mostly on elite infantry and the ability of its first-wave troops to operate behind enemy lines.\nAlthough they lack armored punch, paratroopers are versatile units able to face almost every enemy opponent, and they may count on full air support.

REFTEXT: カービン\n移動中でも発砲可能
CLASSEMENT: Carbine\nCan fire on the move.

REFTEXT: 火炎放射器\n移動中でも発砲可能\n防御されていないユニットに,恐ろしいダメージと制圧を加える
CLASSEMENT: Flamethrower\nCan fire on the move.\nDeals terrible damage to unprotected units, as well as a lot of suppression.

REFTEXT: 対戦車爆弾\n静止時のみ発砲可能,白兵戦距離まで肉薄が必要\n装甲ユニットへの発砲可能
CLASSEMENT: Anti-Tank Grenade\nCan only be used while stationary & at very close range.\nCan only target armored units.

REFTEXT: 銃\n静止時のみ発砲可能
CLASSEMENT: Gun\nCan only fire while stationary.

REFTEXT: 対空兵器\n静止時のみ発砲可能\n地上ユニット,航空ユニットの両方に発砲可能
CLASSEMENT: Anti-Aircraft Gun\nCan only fire while stationary.\nCan target both ground & air units.

REFTEXT: 銃(航空機)\n移動中でも発砲可能\n地上ユニット,航空ユニットの両方に発砲可能
CLASSEMENT: Gun (air)\nCan fire on the move.\nCan target both ground & air units.

REFTEXT: 榴弾砲\n静止時のみ発砲可能\n曲射弾道
CLASSEMENT: Howitzer\nCan only fire while stationary.\nCan fire over obstacles.

REFTEXT: 銃\n静止時のみ発砲可能
CLASSEMENT: Gun\nCan only fire while stationary.
